Mukarramhon U. is the treasurer of this group. She is 44 years old and married. She has two sons and a daughter. Her first son works in construction, and the other children are in school. Mukarramhon and her husband breed cattle. The family earns 3000 KGS per month by reselling cattle after fattening. That profit made it possible for them to save money and make some house repairs. With money received from the loan the family wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding. In the future, Mukarramhon wants to see her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
From the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, 41-year-old Benson M. has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. His main products are potatoes, french beans, maize and milk which are all sold to middlemen. Farming is his main source of income.

Benson has requested this loan of 47,250KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this cow will improve his milk production, ensuring that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The additional income resulting from this loan will enable Benson to pay school fees for his children. In five years' time, he hopes to have expanded his dairy farming by acquiring four more dairy cows. His major challenges have been a lack of market for his products, the high cost of pesticides and poor weather conditions.

Benson is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 11, two of whom are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four children. He and his wife both work to satisfy the family’s needs. His wife works in a local agriculture center. He has 25 years of experience in the concrete field and began to operate his business as a freelance concrete worker in 1995. He works on customer demand. He obtained his first Kiva loan with a successful outcome.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase some wood to make his concrete work stronger. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and to be able to take on some construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: To purchase some wood to make his concrete work stronger

loans.name: Pacita Santos Group

texts.en: Pacita S. is from the village of Punit. She is 51 years old and is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pacita S.. Pacita is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Pacita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Pacita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benson Kanene

texts.en:
Benson Kanene K. is 25 years old and single.  He is a hardworking man. He has operated a retail shop in Babadogo for eight years with income of 7,100 KES per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has never borrowed from any other MFI. Benson's first loan of 20,000 KES will be used to add more stock, such as rice, flour, cooking fat, flour, and soap.  The anticipated profit will be reinvested into the business by purchasing additional stock because customers are attracted by a well stocked shop.  In the future he hopes to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase stock of items, e.g., rice, flour, cooking oil, soaps

loans.name: Anna Leah

texts.en: Anna Leah M. is from the village of Ponce St., Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anna Leah owns and operates a business providing internet services in the local community. Anna Leah has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Anna Leah joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anna Leah is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anna Leah from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Eunice Ene

texts.en:
Eunice is 23 years old and married to Manbui Mereu. They have three children. For the past three years, Eunice has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town. 

Eunice was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy 15 young goats which she will rear and later sell at a profit. In the future, Eunice hopes to practice dairy farming to diversify and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: John Njoroge

texts.en:
John Njoroge K. is 35 years old, married, and has five children.  He has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 13 years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and manure for the farm.  In the future, John hopes to buy his own piece of land where he will be continue farming.

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings and manure for the farm

loans.name: Onduso

texts.en:
Onduso is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for over 8 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans and bananas which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his kiosk which he operates in the same location. 

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES and has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children.

Onduso is 27 years old and married with children ages 2 and 4.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lazarus Mungora

texts.en: Lazarus, who is 34 years old, married to Dorcas Wangui and the father of two children, has operated a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan which he will use to renew the insurance on his motorbike.  In the future, Lazarus hopes to grow his business and buy his own lorry.

loans.use: To renew insurance forhis motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He has been working as a fisherman for over 12 years and has had his own fishing boat since 2002. He buys tools from a local fishing center to support his business operation.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase fishing equipment and supplies and to make much needed repairs to his fishing boat. These improvements will make his fishing operation more secure – especially in disturbing weather. In the future, he would like to purchase another boat. He feels positive about his business prospects for the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and supplies and to make repairs to his fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single woman. She is from Lebanon and lives with her parents and two siblings. She and her father are the sole income providers for the family. Her father works in the agricultural field. She wants to increase her family’s profit. She has been working as a hairdresser for 10 years and, in 2006, she decided to open her own salon. 
 
Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to upgrade her salon tools and purchase vaporization machinery. She wants to offer a comfortable service to her clients and increase her income.

loans.use: To upgrade her salon tools and purchase vaporization machinery

loans.name: Ednita

texts.en: Ednita R. is from the village of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old, separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ednita owns and operate a direct-sales business selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Ednita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Ednita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ednita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ednita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years and employs 10 casual laborers. His main products are tea, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, milk, maize, beans and eggs which he sells locally. Farming is his only source of income.

He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. His major challenges have been lack of enough farm inputs (fertilisers, etc.), pests, diseases and poor weather conditions which affect his production. In five years time, he hopes to acquire a truck that will assist in the transportation of his products to the market. 

Samwel is 39 years old and married with 6 children who are now between the ages of 2 and 18. All the children, except one, attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en: Risa, 22 years of age, has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep and goats to rear and later sell at a profit.  In the future, Risa hopes to practice zero-grazing, which is easier to manage.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren B. is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her mother-in-law's plot of land. Her elder son, Bilguun, 7, attends a local secondary school and her younger son, Chinguun, 1, stays at home. Her husband, Mandaakhuu, 32, operates a taxi in the city. 

Davaasuren has recently been operating a restroom service business at the bus station. She used her earnings to purchase a second-hand car in fair condition.

She is planning to purchase her own plot of land with a wooden house and to provide for the necessary expenses for her children. Davaasuren is requesting a loan to purchase a computer and some spare parts for her family car.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and some spare parts for her family car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She has two years of experience working with mobile phones. She sells rechargeable phone cards from her house. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her parents. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards to sell. Most mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards; it is less common to have an annual phone contract. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her business and own her own phone shop.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Pauline Nateleng

texts.en:
Pauline Nateleng L. is 29 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha market for the last two years.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of 25,000 KES in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy potatoes, carrots, and onions to sell.

In the future, Pauline hopes to be selling fruits and vegetables in large quantities, buying the produce directly from the farmers, and selling to the local retailers.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, carrots, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and four siblings. He helps his brothers to maintain a good income for the family. Despite his young age, he has been working as a freelance electrician specializing in electric projects for four years. He obtained a first Kiva loan and was a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting a larger loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to renew his tools so he can improve his work and take on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: To renew his tools

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah K.  is 31 years old and married with four children who all attend school. 

She has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces maize, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and carrots, which she sells locally. She has been in the farming business for more than 20 years. Her primary challenges are diseases and price fluctuations. She depends mainly on the income from her farm to meet the basic needs of her family.

Zipporah has requested a loan of 35000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to improve her zero-grazing (stall-feeding) farming. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for her children.  In the future, she would like to own at least two quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To improve her livestock farming

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio A. is from the village of District 4. He is 53 years old. Antonio is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Antonio raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for more than 23 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Antonio is requesting a loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three young children, who are attending school. She helps her husband to satisfy the family's income needs. Her husband sells car spare parts. Since 2004, she's owned a clothes store, buying her products from a local clothing center. She always tries to be up-to-date with the market and new designs to attract a good number of clients.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional products for her store so that she can gratify her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Josphat Gichumu

texts.en:
Josphat Gichumu G. is 58 years old, married, and has three children.  He has been making metal products in Naivasha town for the last 14 years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of 25,000 KES in good time.  He plans to use this loan to buy raw materials for his metal workshop.

In the future, Josphat hopes to open a big workshop and be able to make his products in large quantities.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Satyndy's Group

texts.en:
Satyndy T., 48, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi, a small town in the Isykul region. She is married to a driver. Together they are bringing up two sons and two daughters. Satyndy herself works as a nurse in the hospital. Her monthly salary is 2000 KGS. 

Her older son is a truck driver who earns money by transporting goods. She applied for the loan because she needs money to pay for her younger son’s education at university. In the future she wants to see her children married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He is the only income source for his family. He started to work as a car mechanic ten years ago. After seeing a need for this service in his town, he decided to open his own garage in 2006. He obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a punctual client with prompt payments. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to get diverse tools for his garage so he can guarantee his customers a much better service.

loans.use: To get diverse tools for his garage

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah J. is 32 years old and married with four children who all attend school. She has been in the farming business for ten years. Her mixed farm, which is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, produces onions, vegetables, maize, beans, bananas and milk, which are all sold locally. She also runs a food kiosk in the same region.

Sarah's major challenges have been diseases and the high cost of veterinary services. She has requested a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve the living standard of her family.  

Sarah aspires to acquire a vehicle in the future that will assist in the transportation of her products to the local market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz J., the 38-year-old leader of this group, resides in Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. Married to a taxi driver who earns 5000 soms per month, Gulnaz and he are the parents of a son and two daughters. The daughters study at school and the son works in a private enterprise that produces plastic windows. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Gulnaz sells apples, buying them at a low price in the village and then reselling them in the city for an income of about 20000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulnaz wants to purchase more apples for sale.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase apples

loans.name: Esinyen

texts.en:
Esinyen E. is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  He has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town since 2005.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of 20,000 KES in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy dry foodstuff for sell in his shop.

In the future, Esinyen hopes to grow his retail shop to a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase dry foodstuff for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and one sibling. She helps her father assure the family has a good income. She has been growing tobacco for 15 years and in 2000, she bought land so she could produce tobacco and sell it to her own customers.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed products to make her tobacco cultivation easier and faster.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 25 years and employs two farmhands. His main products are maize and tea, which he sells locally. He is also in the business of buying and selling cows at a local market.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to own a posho (cornmeal) mill that will help supplement his income. His biggest challenge has been low prices for his products, especially tea.

Joseph is 52 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 13 and 33. Two of his children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He worked in a barber shop for six years and opened his own shop in 2008. In addition to his brother’s and father’s income, he is also considered to be an income provider for the family. He obtained a first Kiva loan and was an excellent client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to enlarge his business. He will buy more products and tools for his shop so he can satisfy his customers' needs and get higher revenue.

loans.use: To enlarge his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He is the only income source for his family. For 8 years, he has worked as a furniture painter and, in 2004, he started his furniture painting shop. He works closely with locA. galleries in his town. He obtained a first Kiva loan and was a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase more equipment for his painting shop. He wants to enlarge his business so he can work on various types of furniture.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. His farm produces maize, beans and bananas, which are all sold locally. He also operates a shop and a hotel business in the same region. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. His major challenge has been the high cost of farm inputs, which affects his production. In the future, he would like to acquire more land to enable him to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband and two young children, who are still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She helps her husband, a tailor, with the family’s income. She started a lingerie and accessories shop in 2008, after nine years of experience in this field. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her inventory so she can offer her clients new and different styles. She is confident that her work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Sairakul's Group

texts.en:
Sairakul U. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 56 and married to a doctor. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 5,000 soms, Sairakul and her husband started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle after fattening earns 2,000 soms per month for the family. Sairakul applied for the loan because she needs money to pay for her son’s education at the university. In the future, she wants to increase the number of cattle to be able to support her son financially.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repaint his van and perform the necessary maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica A. is 50 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 15 and 25. One of the children attends school.

Pacifica is a farmer in Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces vegetables, maize, beans, tea and milk, which are sold locally. She also earns income from her business of selling snacks to the local market.

She has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the living standard of the family. 

In the future, she would like to buy a vehicle that will assist her in transporting her products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald O. is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 5, who both attend school. He has a mixed farm that produces bananas, maize and beans, which are all sold to the local market. He has been in the farming business for four years and employs two farmhands. He also earns income from his hotel and tailoring businesses in the same region. His biggest challenges have been lack of enough farm inputs (such as fertilizer) and too much rain, which affects his production.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will improve his  milk production and that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He is hopeful that his farming will expand in the future and that he will be able to sell his products wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Los Mosqueteros Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Mosqueteros” es conformado por 17 emprendedores pertenecientes a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Sus principales negocios son de confección, venta de provisiones, ropa, carteras, producción y venta de joyas artesanales y comida rápida.
María Angélica es la presidenta de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha. Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa de casa, como por ejemplo: cortinas, sábanas, cobertores, plumones, manteles, etc., a domicilio y por  encargos, desde hace 3 años.
Con este préstamo, y gracias a sus ahorros, este mes comenzará un nuevo negocio, además del que ya tiene. Se iniciará con la venta de frutas y verduras, naturales y congeladas en su casa. 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artículos para el hogar,  establecida en el centro de la ciudad. Su motivación son sus 3 hijos: su hija de 20 años, quien estudia fonoaudiología en la universidad; su hijo de 16, quien le ayudará con la venta de verduras y su pequeña de 10 años. 
Para  María Angélica, Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo, no solo económico, sino también en la capacitación para administrar bien su negocio.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
“Los Mosqueteros” (The Musketeers) community bank has 17 entrepreneurial members who live in the city of Viña del Mar.  Their main business activities are dressmaking, selling provisions, clothes, purses, making and selling hand-crafted jewelry and selling fast food.

María Angélica is the president of this group.  In the photo she is on the far left in the back row.  Her business is selling household linen such as, for example: drapes, sheets, bedspreads, quilts, tablecloths, etc.  She sells her goods door to door and to order.  She has been in this business for 3 years.   

Thanks to this loan and some savings she has, María Angélica will set up a new business this month in addition to the one she already has.  She will start selling fresh and frozen fruit and vegetables from her home.

María Angélica's dream is to own a store where she can sell household items in the city center.  Her motivation comes from her 3 children: her 20 year-old daughter who is studying speech and language pathology at university, her 16 year-old son, who will help her with her vegetable sales and her 10 year-old daughter.

For María Angélica, Fondo Esperanza has been a great support, not only economically but also through their training sessions which teach members how to run their businesses.  

Viña del Mar is a city and municipality on the central Chilean coast.  It is known as 'The Garden City' owing to the gardens and courtyards that some of the old houses in the city have.  It is also considered the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Los Gemelos Group

texts.es:
Marco forma parte del banco comunal “Los Gemelos” conformado por 21 emprendedores pertenecientes a la comuna de Maipú. En la foto se encuentra al centro y usa un gorro blanco y sus lentes encima.
El negocio de Marco consiste en la elaboración y venta de productos de panadería y pastelería en su casa, desde hace más de 2 años. También hace 4 meses, se dedica a la venta de helados de máquina, ya que la venta de los productos de panadería disminuye en el tiempo de calor. 
Marco comenzó con su negocio independiente, cuando se dio cuenta, por su experiencia laboral, que el trabajo de panadero no es muy conveniente. Su esposa, quien también trabaja con Fondo Esperanza,  lo apoya en el negocio. 
Con este préstamo comprará mezclas para los helados y barquillos.  
Su sueño es tener una amasandería.
Tiene dos hijos: un niño de 11 años y una pequeña de 5 años.
A Marco lo que más le gusta de Fondo Esperanza es la oportunidad que le dan a los emprendedores, cuando les entregan los préstamos, para salir adelante con sus negocios. Además para él los créditos han sido un gran apoyo para mantener su negocio.
Maipú es una comuna ubicada al este de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Designada como la comuna más grande de Chile es llamada Cuna de la Patria debido a importantes hechos históricos ocurridos en esas tierras durante la época de la Independencia, como la Batalla y el Abrazo de Maipú entre los libertadores de Chile Bernardo O´Higgins y Argentina, San Martín.
texts.en:
Marco is part of the "Los Gemelos" (Twins) community bank which has 21 entrepreneurial members who live in the town of Maipú.  In the photo, Marco is in the middle wearing a white cap with sunglasses on top.

Marco's business is making and selling bakery and confectionery products in his home.  He has been doing this for more than 2 years.  He has also been selling ice cream from an ice cream machine since sales of his baked products fall during the hot weather.  Marco started his own business when he realized, through his own work experience, that a baker's work isn't very convenient.  His wife, who also works with Fondo Esperanza, supports him in his business.

He will use his loan to buy mix for his ice creams and cones.  His dream is to own an 'amasanderia' (a type of Chilean bakery).  Marco has two children: an 11 year-old boy and a 5 year-old girl.  What Marco most likes about Fondo Esperanza is the opportunity that they give entrepreneurs when they provide them with loans to get ahead in their businesses.  Also, the loans have been a great support to him in keeping his business running.

Maipú is a town located to the east of Santiago, capital of Chile, in the Metropolitan region.  Designed as the biggest town in Chile it is called the 'Birthplace of the Nation' owing to the important historic events that have taken place on these lands during the Independence period such as the Battle and Embrace of Maipú between the liberators of Chile, Bernardo O'Higgins, and Argentina, San Martín.

loans.use: Mix for ice cream and cones

loans.name: Umurava Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 45 years old and married to a farmer. They have eight children who are between 3 and 22 years old. Alponsine is a group leader of a borrowing group called Umurava CB, which means "Determination" in English. 

Alphonsine sells juice locally produced from sorghum and she has been in this business for three years. She has requested this loan to buy more sorghum to produce more liters of local juice to sell. She says that the profits from this business will be used to buy land for cultivation and pay school fees for her children. She dreams of having her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to produce more local juice to sell

loans.name: Protais

texts.en:
Protais is 55 years old and married to a farmer. They have eight children who are between 15 and 25 years old. All his children go to school. 

Protais owns a business selling a large variety of goods. With this loan, he will add more merchandise such as sugar, sodas, rice, potatoes, eggs and tea to sell. He hopes to use the profit from this business to pay school fees for his children, make savings and build a house. Protais' plan is to work hard and in the future become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more items to resell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric sells clothes. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are three and six years old. His wife is a businessperson. Eric has been selling clothes for 10 years, and he plans to use his loan to stock more clothes to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is forty years old, a widow and has one child who attends school. Josephine sells shoes and clothes for women, especially jackets and T-shirts. She has been in business for one year.

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes and clothes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to pay school fees for her children and reinvest to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.en:
Pierrine is thirty years old, married and has one child. Her husband works as a businessperson. Pierrine sells clothes, especially bed covers and bed sheets, which she has been doing for five years.

Pierrine is requesting a loan to buy more bed covers and bed sheets to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Pierrine plans to reinvest and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more bed covers and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 29 years old, married and has three children between the ages of five and fourteen. Her husband is a businessperson as well.

Odette has been selling charcoal for eight years. Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She hopes to reinvest all new profits and continue to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 35 years old, married and has four children who are between six and fourteen years old. All of her children go to school. Her husband is a businessman.

Claudine has been selling a variety of items from her own boutique for six years. Her loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build her own store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson K. is 60 years old and a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 35 years. His main products are milk, chickens, bananas, maize, and tea, which he sells at the local market and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also depends on his pension pay to cater to the needs of his family. His major challenges in farming have been unpredictable weather conditions and poor market prices for his products.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that he will be able to acquire another asset for his family and that they will also be able to get enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to venture into transport business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Resiato Ene

texts.en: Resiato has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last year. She is 23 years old, married to Jackson K. and they have two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to buy 10 young goats and 15 lambs which she will raise and sell later at a profit. In the future, Resiato hopes to practice large-scale livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy 10 young goats and 15 lambs which she will raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 28 years old and married with two children ages three and six. For the past nine years, he has been in the farming business. Jackson’s mixed farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, and he produces maize, beans, onions, and millet all of which are sold locally.

Jackson is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to improve his farm and pay school fees for his children. Jackson’s major business challenges have been poor weather conditions, pests, diseases and the lack of markets for his products. In the future, Jackson plans to open a retail shop and expand his farm by leasing more land.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 43 years old and married with six children between the ages of two and 26. Four of his children are currently attending school. Jefferson is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya where he has been farming for twenty six years. His mixed farm produces maize, beans, millet, tea, milk and bananas which are all sold locally. Jefferson also earns income from trading cattle. 

Jefferson is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his family will now eat well since he will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. Jefferson also says that his asset base will increase with the purchase of another dairy cow. In future, Jefferson plans to open a big retail shop at a local market.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with eight children who are between the ages of eight and 33. Two of her children are currently attending school. For the past 32 years, Josephine has been practicing mixed farming and she employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, and she produces maize, millet, milk, tea and nappier grass which she sells locally. Farming is her main source of income.

Josephine is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Josephine’s primary business challenges have been poor weather conditions, pests and diseases, and fluctuation in the market prices of her farm products. In the future, Josephine plans to expand her farm and purchase a posho mill to grind flour to supplement her income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert M. is 62 years old, married, and has six adult children. He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya and has been in the farming business for over 30 years.  He employs three casual laborers. Robert sells his farm products at the local market. He also earns income from his posho mill in the same region.

Robert has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable his family to meet their basic needs and improve their livelihood. He plans to acquire more land in the future that will enable him expand his farming activities. He faces the challenges of drought, which affects his production, and bad debtors, which affects his cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr.  Félix oriundo de la Zona de Valle grande Santa Cruz hace 5 años se dedica al transporte publico vive junto con su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, cuenta con una línea (acciones) y un microbús el dinero que solicita es para hacer repara el motor de su microbús la cual es su única fuente de ingresos cuenta con deuda en otra institución pero ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. El sr Félix junto a su familia viven en alquiler y mas adelante desean tener su propia casa en la cual puedan vivir tranquilos y con comodidad es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su esposa, esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Félix is from Valle Grande district, in Santa Cruz.  For the past 5 years he has been providing public transport services.  He lives together with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two children who are studying.  Félix has a route (shares) and a minibus.  He is requesting this loan to repair his minibus engine as it is his only source of income.  He has a debt with another institution but he has shown himself to be a good client.

Félix and his family rent their house and, in the future, they would like to own their own home in which they could live peacefully and comfortably.  Félix is a very hard-working person who is always looking out for the well-being of his children and his wife.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To repair his minibus engine

loans.name: Mabel Yudy

texts.es: La señora Mabel Yudy R. FigueR. es una emprendedora mujer de 40 años que vive en el barrio Universal de la ciudad de Barranquilla en compañía de sus tres hijas y un nieto. Tiene una venta de comidas rápidas en la cual ofrece perros calientes, hamburguesas, bandejas de papitas fritas con salchichas y arepas rellenas con queso, pollo y carne molida. El negocio funciona en su casa los viernes, sábados, domingos y festivos. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 4 P.M. y se extiende hasta la media noche. En la preparación de los alimentos y la atención al público le colaboran sus dos hijas mayores. El negocio nació hace 3 años por sugerencia de algunos vecinos quienes conocen sus aptitudes culinarias. Además del negocio de comidas, ella tiene una máquina de coser familiar en la que elabora cubre lechos y cortinas por encargo. Este es el primer crédito que ella tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar varios juegos de sillas y mesas plásticas al igual que ingredientes para sus productos. El promedio de ventas semanales es de $400.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%. El esposo de la microempresaria está en Europa y a pesar que le colabora en los gastos de la casa, siente la ausencia de la figura paterna en la educación de sus hijas. En un futuro, la señora Mabel piensa alquilar un local para independizar el negocio del hogar y también para vender almuerzos diariamente. Si éste proyecto llega a concretarse, piensa utilizar la misma estrategia empleada hasta ahora: excelentes productos al mejor precio de la plaza.
texts.en:
Mabel Yudy R. FigueR. is an enterprising, 40 year-old woman who lives in Universal neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, together with her three daughters and a grandchild.  Mabel's business is selling fast food.  She sells hot dogs, burgers, trays of French fries with sausages and rolls filled with cheese, chicken and ground meat.  She runs her business from her home on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.  Her work day starts at 4.00pm and lasts until midnight.  Mabel's two eldest daughters help her in preparing the food and serving customers.  She started her business 3 years ago on the recommendation of some of her neighbors who know how good she is at cooking.

As well as running her food business, Mabel also has a family sewing machine with which she sews bedclothes and drapes to order.  This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying several sets of plastic tables and chairs as well as ingredients for making her food.  

Mabel's average weekly sales amount to 400,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 40%.  This small businesswoman's husband is in Europe and although he helps with the household expenses, the absence of a father figure is felt in the education of her daughters.  In the future, Mabel is planning to hire premises so that she can separate her business from her home and also so that she can sell meals every day.  If this project becomes a reality, she is planning to use the same strategy she has used up to now: offer excellent products at the best price.

loans.use: To buy several sets of plastic tables and chairs as well as ingredients for making her food

loans.name: Magoma Nezikokolima Group-Mityana

texts.en: Emmanuel K. is 45 years old, married, and has five children.  He is a member of the Magoma Nezikokolima group-Mityana.  Emmanuel has been operating his pub business in Kiyoganyi trading center for 20 years. He says he got ideas on how to run a business from his parents.  Before that, he was working as a bartender and doing some farming. Emmanuel's business generates 20,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, Emmanuel is going to buy more crates of both soft and hard drinks to sell at his pub.

loans.use: To purchase crates of both soft and hard drinks for resell at his pub

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio tiene como principal actividad económica el servicio técnico en reparación de televisores, radios DVD y otros aparatos electrónicos, la mayor parte de su conocimiento en el área lo adquirió de manera empírica con la practica y también pasando cursos de mantenimiento técnico,  brinda este servicio en un ambiente en una calle muy comercial de la ciudad de la Paz, el vive en la zona de alto Tacagua en casa de su mama junto a su esposa y a sus hijos, su esposa es enfermera y ayuda en los gastos familiares, don julio trabaja desde la mañana hasta la noche para poder solventar los gastos de su familia y en un futuro poder comprar una casa propia, el préstamo que solicito es para la compra de televisores actividad en la que piensa incursionar para incrementar sus ingresos, sus conocimientos en esta área ayudaron a tomar esta decisión, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julio's main business activity is repairing televisions, radios, DVD players and other electrical appliances.  He acquired most of his knowledge in the field in an empirical manner, through practice.  He also took some courses in technical maintenance.  He provides his service in a street with a lot of commercial activity in the city of La Paz.

Julio lives in Alto Tacagua district, in his mom's house, together with his wife and children.  His wife is a nurse and helps with the family's expenses.  Julio works from morning to evening in order to cover his family's expenses and so that, in the future, he can buy his own home.  He will use this loan to buy televisions, an activity which he is thinking of breaking into in order to increase his income.  His knowledge in this field helped him to take this decision.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy televisions

loans.name: Ong'angi

texts.en:
Ong'angi is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya where he has been farming for eighteen years. He sells his maize, beans, vegetables and tea to the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. Ong'angi is also a primary school teacher.

Ong'angi is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children. Ong'angi’s biggest business challenges have been diseases, poor weather conditions, and poor infrastructure. In future, Ong'angi plans to acquire a vehicle to help him transport his products to the market. He also plans to open a big retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra Vásquez L. tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 21 y 16 años en el barrio Los Jardines de la ciudad de Cartagena, la más turística e histórica de Colombia. Ella tiene en su residencia un taller de modistería en el cual produce principalmente blusas, faldas y vestidos de mujer. Aprendió ese oficio hace veinte años ayudándole a una amiga en otro taller, luego decidió independizarse y compro su primera máquina de coser. Hoy cuenta con una buena clientela formada por vecinos, familiares, amigos y referidos de otros sectores de la ciudad. El éxito de su negocio está en producir prendas sobre medida, porque según ella, no existen dos mujeres que tengan cuerpos idénticos. Además de confeccionar, la señora Sandra suele aconsejar a sus clientas qué tipo de moda y color es el que mejor se acomoda a su figura. Con los ingresos que genera su negocio aporta a la financiación del 40 % de los gastos familiares y ha podido sufragar los estudios universitarios de su hijo mayor. Este es el sexto préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos y accesorios. Con el  primer  préstamo recibido compró una máquina de coser industrial y con el segundo una fileteadora, esto le ha permitido mejorar sustancialmente el acabado de las prendas.Sus ventas mensuales ascienden a $1.200.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 45%.  La señora Sandra alterna su oficio de confeccionista con la producción de adornos en cerámica. En la decoración de estos últimos le colabora su hijo menor en sus ratos libres, ella dice que hay que ser ingeniosos a la hora de generar ingresos porque en materia de trabajo no se pueden colocar todos los huevos en la misma canasta.
texts.en:
Sandra Vásquez L. is 39 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children, aged 21 and 16, in Los Jardines neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena, the most historic city in Colombia which also attracts most tourists.

Sandra has a dressmaking workshop in her home where she mainly makes women's blouses, skirts and dresses.  She learned this trade twenty years ago, helping a friend in another workshop.  She then decided to start working independently and bought her first sewing machine.  Today she has a good customer base made up of neighbors, family members, friends and people from other areas of the city who she has been recommended to.  The success of Sandra's business lies in producing made-to-measure clothes because she believes that no two women have identical bodies.

As well as making clothes, Sandra usually advises her customers about what type of fashion and color best suits their figure.  She uses the profits from her business to cover 40% of her family's expenses and she has also been able to pay for her eldest son's university studies.

This is Sandra's sixth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fabric, threads and accessories.  She used her first loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and her second to buy an overlock sewing machine.  This has allowed her to substantially improve the finishing steps of making her clothes.

Sandra's monthly sales amount to 1,200,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 45%.  Sandra divides her time between her dressmaking business and making ceramic decorations.  Her youngest son helps her to decorate these in his free time.  She says that you have to be clever when it comes to making income because, as far as work is concerned, you can't afford to put all your eggs in one basket.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads and accessories

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 57 years old and married with seven adult children. For the past 25 years, he has been in the farming business. Fredrick’s farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, where he produces beans, maize and tea to sell at the local market and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Fredrick is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his family will be assured of enough milk for both domestic consumption and sale. The profits from this loan will help improve Fredrick’s farm. In the future, he plans to acquire more dairy cows and expand his milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luzmila; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia es ama de casa, se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y de su casa , por el momento es la única actividad que realiza ya que después desea buscar un empleo el cual le pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y ella pueda sentirse mejor. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su hogar de primera necesidad y para su uso personal.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Luzmila is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She is a housewife who looks after her child and her home.  At the moment, this is the only activity that she carries out since she later wants to look for a job which will enable her to provide her child with a better quality of life and enable herself to feel better.

Luzmila is requesting this loan to buy essentials for her household and for personal use.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy essentials for her household and for personal use

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive ahí desde hace 8 años en alquiler, tiene dos lotes en la urb. Satélite donde esta construyendo su casa. El tiene una imprenta y serigrafía  el cual lo atienden junto a su esposa y una de sus hijas, por estas fiestas de fin de año tienen mucho trabajo  en la elaboración de tarjetas y calendarios,  el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción  para terminar de construir su casa. El sr. Moisés es proactivo en su trabajo y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas, son una familia muy unida, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Moisés lives in Plan 3000 neighborhood.  He has been living in a rented house there for 8 years.  He has two plots of land in the Satélite development where he is building a house.

Moisés has a printing and silk screen printing business where he works together with his wife and one of his daughters.  They have a lot of work with the end-of-year holiday season, making cards and calendars. 

Moisés is requesting a loan to buy building materials so that he can finish building his house.  Moisés is proactive in his work and has the support of his daughters.  They are a very close family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Elena Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Elena Mercedes Meléndez Q. es una laboriosa mujer  de 69 años que vive en compañía de un hijo y tres nietos en el municipio de San Jacinto, centro del  departamento de Bolívar, al norte del país. Esta localidad es famosa nacionalmente por sus hermosas artesanías, especialmente hamacas, mochilas y sombreros. La  microempresaria tiene desde hace treinta años en su casa un taller de modistería en el cual produce vestidos, pantalones, uniformes escolares,  blusas y camisas. Estas últimas las  decora con bordados manuales y  vende en promedio a $120.000 COP por requerir tanto trabajo. Ella aprendió la modistería siendo muy joven en su pueblo natal, viendo cómo su mamá les hacía los trajes y pantalones a sus hermanos menores. Al principio cosía a mano su propia ropa, luego su padre le regaló una máquina de coser  familiar y así empezó a coser para otras personas. Este es el primer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar telas, hilos, botones y accesorios. El promedio de venta mensual  es de $ 1.200.000 COP y su margen de utilidad es del 40%. En los meses de Enero y Febrero las ventas aumentan considerablemente por la demanda de uniformes para la temporada escolar. La señora Elena es viuda, tiene cuatro hijos que trabajan y le colaboran económicamente. Confeccionar prendas de vestir es para ella un oficio muy agradable que seguirá ejerciendo mientras tenga buena salud y bordar, más que un trabajo, es una actividad que la entretiene. Dice con orgullo que es una autodidacta, nunca asistió a ninguna escuela técnica y su mayor satisfacción es ver lucir a sus clientes la ropa que ella produce.
texts.en:
Elena Mercedes Meléndez Q. is a hard-working, 69 year-old woman who lives with one of her sons and three grandchildren in the town of San Jacinto, in the center of Bolívar province, in the north of the country.  This town is famous nationwide for its beautiful handicrafts, especially hammocks, backpacks and hats.

This small businesswoman has had a dressmaking workshop in her home for thirty years.  She makes dresses, pants, school uniforms, blouses and shirts.  She decorates these last items, embroidering them by hand and sells them for an average of 120,000 Colombian pesos as they require a lot of work.  Elena learned her trade as a dressmaker in her home town when she was very young.  She watched how her mom made dresses and pants for her younger siblings.  At the beginning, Elena used to sew her own clothes by hand, then her father gave her a family sewing machine as a present and she started sewing for other people.

This is Elena's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fabric, threads, buttons and accessories.  Her monthly sales average is 1,200,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 40%.  During the months of January and February her sales increase considerably as there is a lot of demand for uniforms during the back-to-school season.  

Elena is a widow.  She has four children who all work and help out financially.  Making clothes is a very enjoyable job for Elena and she will continue in this work while she still benefits from good health and embroidering, more than a job, is an activity that she really enjoys doing.  She says with pride that she is self taught.  She never attended any technical school and her biggest satisfaction is seeing her customers wearing the clothes that she makes.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, buttons and accessories

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plantas para luego distribuirlo de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia se dedica al préstamo de dinero ganando ella un porcentaje del monto que presta, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma ella sale adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería ( plantas) para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Flora is 30 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling plants.  She delivers her plants to her customers who request them.  Flora also lends money.  She makes a percentage on the sums that she lends.  She is a very happy and optimistic person and, in this way, she gets ahead in life.

Flora is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise (plants) for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (plants) for her business

loans.name: Fany

texts.es: La señora Fany G. G. tiene 38 años y vive en compañía de su esposo y dos hijos en el barrio El Tesoro de la ciudad de Bogotá. Tiene un taller en el cual fabrica productos en fibra de vidrio como deslizadores, túneles y balancines para parques infantiles. El negocio comenzó hace cuatro años cuando el esposo de la microempresaria quedó desempleado luego de trabajar por más de veinte años en el ramo de la fibra de vidrio. En un principio las ventas eran bajas, pero fueron aumentando gracias a la labor de promoción y mercadeo de la señora Fany. Hoy sus productos gozan de un gran prestigio debido  a la calidad de los mismos; son tan buenos que ella otorga dos años de garantía, mientras que la competencia da sólo 18 meses. Los más importantes clientes del negocio son otras empresas que reciben contratos grandes del sector público o privado para construir parques infantiles y ellos a su vez sub contratan con microempresas como la de la señora Fany. Ella es quien maneja la parte administrativa y comercial, su esposo se encarga de la parte operativa, pero cuando los pedidos aumentan considerablemente no es raro verla con guantes y mascarilla pintando con soplete los productos. Este es el segundo préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de fibra de vidrio, resina, catalizadores y pinturas. Con el primer crédito compró nuevos moldes y herramientas. Cuando los pedidos de piezas para parques infantiles disminuyen, la microempresaria también produce guarda barros para automóviles, lava cabezas para peluquerías, toboganes para piscinas y jacuzzis para baños. Ella en general produce cualquier objeto en fibra de vidrio, pero lo que más le gusta fabricar son piezas para parques infantiles porque, según su esposo, eso equivale a producir felicidad a los niños de Colombia.
texts.en:
Fany G. G. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in El Tesoro neighborhood, in the city of Bogotá.  She has a workshop where she makes products from fiberglass such as slides, tunnels and seesaws for children's playgrounds.

Fany started her business four years ago when her husband lost his job after having worked for more than twenty years in the fiberglass industry.  At first, her sales were low but they increased thanks to her work promoting and marketing the business.  Today her products enjoy great prestige owing to their quality.  The quality of her products is so good that she offers her customers a two year guarantee whilst her competition only offer 18 months.

Fany's most important customers are companies who receive large contracts, in the public or private sector, to build children's playgrounds.  They, in turn, sub contract small businesspeople such as Fany.  Fany manages the administrative and commercial side of the business.  Her husband is in charge of the manufacturing side.  However, when orders increase considerably it isn't unusual to see Fany with her gloves and mask on, spray painting the products.

This is Fany's second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fiberglass, resin, catalysts and paints wholesale.  She used her first loan to buy new molds and tools.  When the orders for children's playgrounds slow down, this small businesswoman also produces mudguards for cars, sinks for hairdressing salons, slides for swimming pools and jacuzzis for baths.  In general, she produces any object in fiberglass but what she most likes making are items for children's playgrounds because, according to her husband, this means they are producing happiness for the children of Colombia.

loans.use: To buy fiberglass, resin, catalysts and paints wholesale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante la socia trabaja todos los días brindando el servicio de almuerzo y cena, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta forma saca  a su familia delante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más insumos para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, menestras entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Elsa is 26 years old.  She lives with her partner and child.  Elsa divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She works every day, providing lunch and dinner service.  This is the only business activity that she carries out at the moment and it is how she gets her family ahead.

Elsa is requesting this loan so that she can buy more supplies for her business such as rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business such as rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TARPUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Maria; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo D. cuidado D. sus hijos, la socia es ama D. casa y en algunas oportunidades hace algunos pequeños negocios como venta D. productos D. belleza, la socia quiere tener una tienda donD. pueda vender los productos D. belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento D. su casa, para uso personal.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Tarpuy community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. the member is Mrs Juana Maria; she is 60 years old, married and has 5 children. She divides her daily activities with the work of caring for her children. She is a housewife and works in various small businesses, such as selling beauty products, then the opportunity arises. She wants to have a store where she can sell beauty products. She is requesting this loan for home maintenance for her home; for personal use. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for maintenance for her home; for personal use

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo C. M. tiene 35 años, Es Soltero vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de  siembra de maíz, arroz.

Víctor Hugo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García en Zapotal y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una micro empresa.

Le gusta escuchar música y hacer deporte.
texts.en: Víctor Hugo C. M. is 35, single, and lives alone in the Ventanas Canton, in the Los Rios province. He has no children. The members of the community bank V.R.C. Nuevo Amanecer ["New Dawn"] are located in the San Luiz Zapotal district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This group of 12 members is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labours, sowing corn and rice. Victor Hugo works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in the Garcia Market in Zapotal and sells them in the same location. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for cultivation. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and climatic variability. His dream is to have a micro business. He enjoys listening to music and playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcia; ella tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de medicinas (botica) multiservicios ya que también ahí vende celulares, regalitos para cumpleaños entre otros esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y espera tal vez más adelante abrir otra botica para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad vida a sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implemnetacion de su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Chikon community bank; this bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Marcia; she is 36, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She sells multi-drug medicines (she has a pharmacy) and also sells cell phones and small birthday gifts, among other items. This is her only job at the moment and she hopes to later open another pharmacy in order to offer her children a better quality of life. She is requesting this loan to stock her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan for her business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La Sra. Sabina llego a nuestra oficina por recomendación de un cliente de nuestra institución, La Sra. Sabina tiene su casita propia en la que vive con sus hijos, su actividad es venta de refrescos y cerveza los días viernes, sábados, domingo y lunes, también tiene una rockola mientras los clientes disfrutan de sus bebidas frías pueden escuchar una buena música, el dinero solicitado será para aumentar su capital, (compra de refrescos y bebidas), la Sra. Sabina esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo que le brindo cuando necesitaba.
texts.en: Sabina came to Emprender's office on the recommendation of another client. Sabina has her own home where she lives with her children, her activity is selling drinks and beer on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. She also has a jukebox, so while her clients enjoy their cold drinks they can also listen to good music. The requested loan will be used to increase her working capital to buy drinks. Sabina is grateful to Emprender for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: To buy drinks by the case

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime Sánchez Q. tiene 51 años y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Bogotá. Posee un puesto estacionario en el cual vende galletas, confites, chocolates, cigarrillos, gaseosas y jugos; además, presta el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos celulares.  El negocio está ubicado en el barrio Chapinero cerca al teatro nacional Fanny Mickey, famoso por realizar las mejores funciones teatrales y musicales del país.
