She is 52, married to a surveyor, and they have 5 sons and daughters: Leonardo, 32 who is an engineer, Juan Carlos, 31 who is in information technology, Dulce María, 30, who is in public relations, Israel, 26, who is an economist, and Rodolfo, 15, who is studying in the CBTIS of Ciudad Ayala.  Verónica finished basic education and studied to be an executive secretary.  She will use her loan to supply her business. She is going to buy patented pharmaceuticals.  She began with KIVA loans and Fundación Realidad through the invitation of a friend. She has a pharmacy in her neighborhood, and she also sells patented pharmaceuticals, perfumes, baby clothes and gifts.  Her business is called Farmacia (Pharmacy) Mega and she has had  it for 15 years.  Previously she worked in a pharmacy in Cuautla.  People who knew her suggested that she open a pharmacy in her area until finally, with the help of her sister, they established the first one.  Between the two of them they handled the business and then she helped her sister open one for herself.
They also had a restaurant in the area but they closed it because they couldn’t find people who knew about the business.
She rents a store that is 200 meters from her house and every day she walks over to her business.  She considers her business very important because she gets to meet and talk with many people, it serves as a distraction, and she earns money.  What she most likes about it are the sales.  From the time she was little she sold from her mother’s house.  It was a big lot and there were many fruit trees.  She would gather the fruit  from the trees in a basket and go out to sell, and then she would give the money that she made to her mother so that she would buy something delicious to eat.  When she was 14 she was buying soft drinks and selling them outside of her mother’s house.  Later “I went to Jalsico and began to buy blankets, sheets, cushions, and napkins that I could purchase very cheaply and I would make good money when I went to Zapata park in Cuautla  to sell the merchandise“.  
She has always liked sales. She gets a lot of pleasure from her work because she can buy what she likes and she is proud to say that it has moved her sons and daughters ahead and helped them study for careers in the university.  Her regular customers are her own neighbors.  On the average she sees about 20 to 30 people  of all ages every day.  Her customers buy from her because they know she treats them well and that is why her business is known throughout the area.  Now there are two other pharmacies that have opened there  but they don’t really affect her business.  She uses the money that she makes mostly in keeping up her medicine supply, to pay the rent, and to pay an employee. She will use the KIVA loan to buy patented pharmaceuticals and to purchase a showcase for the stuffed animals that she sells for gifts.  She has her plans and hopes to builf her own pharmacy so that she won’t have to pay rent any more. The best will be that her youngest son continues studying and have a career.  She feels happy with the loan because it will supply her business.  Some of her words for the KIVA team are “I appreciate that you help us with the loan to improve the business.  The town of Moyotepec likes it because the business started here and grew here. Moyotepec has a hot climate, they grow sugar cane, beans, onions, and corn.

loans.use: To buy patented pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez vive en el poblado de Moyotepec  del municipio de CD. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos. Ella tiene 37 años de edad estudio secretaria ejecutiva, ella tiene su negocio de farmacia en el cual va a invertir el préstamo. Principalmente lo va a utilizar para comprar medicamento genérico, perfumería, pañales, papel higiénico, etc. hace dos años que inicio con su farmacia, ella aprendió el negocio porque estuvo trabajando mucho tiempo en farmacias y después decidió poner su negocio sacando prestamos. Sus ingresos son aproximadamente el 30% de sus ventas. Anteriormente no tuvo otros negocios. Su farmacia está en la Col. Año de Juárez en Cuautla, su negocio se llama Farmacia García de su negocio a su domicilio se hace una  hora. Le gusta su trabajo por la disponibilidad de tiempo y que puede trabajar para ayudar  a su familia. Su trabajo le enorgullece porque puede ayudar a la gente. hay una persona que le ayuda a atender el negocio en la mañana y ella lo atiende en la tarde, sus clientes son todo tipo de gente y al día atiende entre 30 a 40 personas al día. Las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio las utiliza para reinvertir, además está ahorrando para ampliar su negocio y poder meter más mercancía como regalos.
La señora Gabriela es casada, su esposo es campesino y él no tiene un ingreso fijo, tienen un hijo que se llama Ángel Gabriel, él actualmente está estudiando la primaria. Su negocio es muy importante para ella porque ha ayudado económicamente a su familia, también desea en el futuro ampliar su casa y construir su cocina. ella Quiere lograr que a través de su negocio pueda sacar adelante a su hijo y que estudie la universidad. Se siente muy contenta al recibir su préstamo y poder invertir más en su negocio y de esa manera obtener más ganancias para tener más dinero y salir adelante.  La señora Gabriela quiere decirle  a KIVA y a Fundacion Realidad lo siguiente: “gracias por el préstamo y que amplíen el monto del préstamo”
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez lives in the town of Moyotepec, a municipality of Ciudad Ayala in Morelos state.  She is 37 years old and studied to be an Executive Secretary.  She has a pharmacy in which she will invest her loan.  She will mainly use it to buy generic medicines, perfumery, diapers, toilet paper, etc.  She started her pharmacy two years ago.  She learned the business because she worked in pharmacies for a long time and she then decided to set up her own business taking out loans.  Her income is about 30% of sales.  She hasn’t had any previous businesses.  Her pharmacy is the Año de Juárez neighborhood in Cuautla.  Her business is called “Farmacia García.”  Travel time from home to her business is an hour.

She enjoys the work because time is available and she can work to help her family.  Her work makes her proud because she can help people.  She has a person who helps her tend to the store during mornings and she tends to it in the afternoons.  Her customers are all kinds of people and she has between 30 and 40 customers daily.  Profits from the business are used to reinvest.  In addition, she is saving up to expand the business in order to stock more merchandise like gift items.

Gabriela is married.  Her husband is a field hand and does not earn a steady income.  They have a son, Ángel Gabriel, who is currently in elementary school.  

Her business is very important to her because it has helped her family economically.  She also hopes in the future to enlarge her house and build her kitchen.  She hopes to support her son through her business so that he can go to the university.

She feels very happy upon getting the loan and being able to invest more in her business thus obtaining more profits to have more money to get ahead.

Graciela would like to say the following to KIVA and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for the loan and for enlarging the amount of the loan.”

loans.use: To buy generic medicines, perfumery, diapers and toilet paper.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
Ana Karen P. García es originaria del  poblado de Moyotepec municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Tiene 21 años de edad, ella concluyó la educación básica, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos se llaman Leyla de 4 años de edad esta e preescolar, Iker de un año tres meses de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo y va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar zapato para niño y niña y zapatos para dama y caballero. Inicio en los préstamos por una amiga que la invitó a invertir en un negocio a través de un préstamo. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 meses la invito la prima de su esposo con las ventas por catalogo con las ganancias fue comprando zapatos y los pone en exhibición, Le prestan una vitrina en una farmacia de la localidad para mostrar sus productos.
Su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene, que principalmente destina para comprar más mercancía y para los gastos de su casa. La parte que más le gusta de su negocio es salir cada día a ofrecer sus productos y que le encarguen pedidos de calzado. En promedio visita de cinco a ocho personas por día. Su negocio enfrenta los desafíos de las inclemencias del tiempo, sobre todo cuando llueve, además de que enfrenta la competencia de personas que también venden por catálogo en su localidad. Las ganancias de su negocio las destina en mayor parte a comprar más zapatos. Tiene como meta a corto plazo meter productos diferentes como bolsas de dama, blusas y esto lo va lograr con el préstamo primero y después con las ganancias de la invierte. Su negocio es muy importante porque le va a ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia económicamente y además de que en el futuro hacer mejoras a su vivienda como ponerle puerta a su casa, ventanas, echarle el piso de cemento y los vidrios. A ella le gustaría desarrollarse más en el campo de las ventas y crecer más profesionalmente. Con respecto al préstamo se siente contenta porque va a poder invertir más en su negocio. La señora Ana Karen quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con estos préstamos para crecer más en los negocios”.
texts.en:
Ana Karen P. García is from the town of Moyotepec, a municipality in Ciudad Ayala, Morelos state, México.  She is 21 years old and finished basic education.  She‘s married and has two children: Leyla, 4, who is in preschool and Iker, who is a year and 3 months old.  Her business is catalogue based shoe sales for boys, girls, women and men.  She will use the loan to buy shoes for boys, girls, women and men.  A friend of hers invited her to join the loans to invest in a business through the loans.  She started the business five months ago.  Her husband’s cousin invited her to join the catalogue shoe sales.  She has used profits to buy shoes to display.  They lend her a display case in a local pharmacy to display her products.

Her business is important thanks to the profits it earns which she used primarily to buy more merchandise and to meet household expenses.  The part she likes best about her business is going out daily to offer her products and receive orders for footwear.  On average, she sees between 5-8 customers daily.  Her business faces challenges like the inclemency of the weather, especially when it rains besides facing competition from people in her community who are also into catalogue sales.

She uses profits from the business primarily to reinvest in more shoes.  Her short term goal is to add other items to her inventory like ladies’ purses and blouses.  She hopes to accomplish this first with the loan and then with profits from the investment.

Her business is very important to her because it will help her support her family economically as well as make improvements to her house in the future like installing a door, window frames, cement flooring and glass windows.

She would like to develop further in sales and grow professionally.  With respect to the loan, she feels happy because she will be able to invest more in her business.  Ana Karen would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for supporting us with these loans so that we can grow more in our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy shoes for boys, girls and women.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia P. A. vive en la localidad de Moyotepec municipio de Cd.  Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Tiene 41 años, estudio la educación básica hasta la primaria  de niña, y termino la secundaria ya casada en el INEA. El crédito lo va utilizar principalmente para comprar insumos para su negocio como son: un comal para tostar semilla de calabaza, una parrilla de gas, queso de hebra, tomates chiles, azúcar, hojas para tamal manteca, carne, chocolate. La señora Antonia pretende utilizar una parte del préstamo para realizar algunas mejorías en su hogar que le permitan también mejorar en su negocio como son: echar piso firme en la cocina de su domicilio. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tamales, atole, semilla de calabaza tostada y molida para el mole verde (pipián); Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, en aquel entonces la necesidad el obligo a iniciar una  actividad económica. Aprendió el oficio a traves de una prima de su esposo que le enseño a elaborar tamales, antes de dedicarse a la venta de tamales se dedico a otras actividades, vendiendo fruta y verdura de casa en casa, vendia tortillas elaboradas a mano, picaditas y le iba muy bien en su negocio. También cuando es temporada vende mangos y toronjas.
 Su negocio no está establecido, ella  vende de casa en casa los días lunes, miércoles y sábado en su localidad. Su trabajo aunque es pesado, porque lo hace caminando, es importante porque le ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijos en la escuela y los gastos de la casa, disfruta mucho las labores de su oficio como el dorar la semilla, preparar los tamales. Una gran satisfacción que le da su negocio es que siempre tiene dinero para sus necesidades y también para sus gustos. Un momento de gran orgullo para ella fue cuando, con unos ahorros que junto de su trabajo, compró material para repellar las paredes de su casa.
Su negocio principalmente ayuda  a las amas de casa que cuando no prepararon de comer le compran a ella sus productos (tamales. Mole, picaditas, etc.). Nos comenta que en promedio atiende entre 50 y 60 personas. Algunos de los desafíos que ha enfrentado en su negocio son la contante alza de los precios y las inclemencias del tiempo.
La señora Antonia señala que para ella es muy importante su negocio porque le ha ayudado a salir adelante con sus hijos y le gustaría que a través de su trabajo cada día este mejor con su familia que no les falte nada. Le da gusto recibir este préstamo y siente una gran responsabilidad por pagarlo. La señora Antonia quiere decirle a KIVA “muchas gracias por confiar en mí y darme el préstamo porque es de gran ayuda para mi negocio y para mi familia y que además le me dan facilidad para ir pagándolo y es poco el interés”. A ella le gusta su comunidad porque desde ahí en días despejados se ve el volcán (popocatepetl) y los cerros y es campo abierto.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia P. A. lives in the town of Moyotepec, municipality of Cd. Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 41 years old. As a girl she studied basic education in primary school and finished high school in the INEA open system after marriage. She is going to use this loan principally to buy consumable products for her business: a griddle to toast pumpkin seeds, a gas grill, string cheese, tomatoes, chiles, sugar, tamale leaves, butter, meat, and chocolate.   

Ms. Antonia hopes to use a part of the loan to carry out some improvements to her home which will allow her to improve her business. Specifically, to put down a hard floor in the kitchen of her house. She has a business which sells tamales, atole (a maize drink), and toasted and ground pumpkin seeds for green mole/pipian (a sauce for stewing). She started this business 10 years ago when necessity obliged her to take on an economic activity. She learned the trade from a cousin of her husband who taught her how to make tamales. Before dedicating herself to tamale sales, she had other activities; selling fruit and vegetables door to door, and selling hand-made tortillas and picaditas, and her business was going very well. As well, she sells mangos and grapefuit when in season.

Her business is not fixed. She sells door to door on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays in her community. Her work, although heavy as she does it on foot, is important because it helps her to get her children ahead in school and with the household expenses. She enjoys the tasks of her trade, such as browning the seed and preparing the tamales. A big satisfaction she gets from her business is always having money for her necessities as well as for her pleasure. A moment of great pride for her was when, with some savings from her work, she bought material to plaster the walls of her house.    

Her business principally helps housewives who, when they don't prepare something to eat, buy her products (tamales, mole, picaditas, etc.) We mention that on average she serves between 50 and 60 people. Some of the challenges she has confronted in her business are the constant rise in prices and harsh weather. 

Ms. Antonia points out that her business is very important to her because it has helped her and her children to get ahead and she would like that through her work each day is better with her family and that they don't lack anything. She is pleased to receive this loan and feels a large responsibility to repay it. Ms. Antonoa wants to say to Kiva "thank you very much for having confidence in me and giving me this loan because it is a big help for my business and for my family. Also, it gives me easy repayment terms and small interest." She likes her community because from here on clear days you can see the volcano (popocatepetl) and the hills, and it is open country.

loans.use: To buy a tortilla griddle to brown the seed, a gas grill, leaves for tamales, chiles, butter, cane, Oaxaca cheese, sugar, chocolate

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia T. Martínez vive en la localidad de Moyotepec, municipio de CD. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Actualmente tiene 35 años concluyó la educación básica termino la secundaria tiene su certificado. Ella tiene su negocio de renta de manteles, mesas y sillas. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para comprar más manteles para incrementar su negocio. Se enteró de KIVA y Fundación Realidad a través de una amiga que la invitó a participar en un grupo que había en su localidad. Su negocio se llama “casa Vargas”, ella y  su esposo tienen este negocio desde hace ocho años. Ellos regresaron hace ocho años de trabajar en Estados Unidos y no sabían en que invertir el dinero que traían. Entonces un amigo les platico que era buena idea invertir en mesas y sillas para rentar y adquirieron el material para poner su negocio. Antes de este negocio había vendido ropa pero ese negocio no le convenció. Su negocio esta en su casa y atiende a sus clientes su esposo lleva las sillas, las mesas y manteles en su camioneta. Considera su negocio muy importante porque de ahí obtienen los ingresos para los gastos grandes de su casa y también para los gastos del diario. Los mayores desafíos que enfrentan es el de surtir contratos grandes, porque es mucho trabajo. Su negocio le enorgullece que entre más tiempo pasa lo van recomendando más y viene gente incluso de otros pueblos a rentarles. Un momento muy especial para ella fue cuando compraron las primeras mesas y sillas para rentar las utilizaron para la fiesta de los tres años de su hijo. Nos menciona que su negocio es popular porque aunque vengan de lejos ellos les dan servicio al precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta es que a veces se le pierde al cliente y se los tienen que cobrar; no tienen competencia en su localidad y eso les facilita el trabajo. Piensa que a futuro va comprar más material para su negocio, mesas redondas fundas para silla y se vean más presentables, ella espera que con las ganancias extras del préstamo lo pueda lograr.
La señora Leticia es casada, su esposo trabaja dando clases de inglés de manera particular. Tiene dos hijos, Sergio de 9 años estudia la primaria y Cynthia de 3 años. Su esposo le ayuda entregando las mesas y recogiéndolas  considera que su negocio es muy importante porque aunque invirtieron mucho al principio ahora el negocio les da buena ganancia. En cuanto a su domicilio nos comenta que quiere hacer un segundo piso y más recamaras para sus hijos. Sus esperanzas son que a través de su negocio y esfuerzo puedan sacar adelante la educación de sus hijos. Comenta que cuando recibe el préstamo se siente muy contenta y comprometida  a la vez porque sabe que tiene que invertir para su negocio y dar mejor servicio al cliente y pagar su préstamo. La señora Leticia quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “que está muy bien que presten el dinero porque el interés es bajo y ayudan a los negocios”- Moyotepec localidad en donde vive le gusta mucho porque es muy tranquilo el paisaje se ven muchos árboles y la gente siembra maíz y caña de azúcar.
texts.en:
Leticia T. Martínez lives in the City of Moyotepec, located in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She’s 35 years old, has completed junior high school and has her diploma.  She runs a business where she rents out tables, tablecloths, and chairs and will use the money from this loan to buy more tablecloths to grow her business.

She found out about Kiva and Fundación Realidad through a friend who invited her to participate in a local group.  Her business is called “Casa Vargas,” and she and her husband have had it for eight years.  When they returned from working in the United States eight years ago, they didn’t know how to invest the money that they had.  A friend told them that it would be a good idea to invest in tables and chairs to rent out, so they acquired the items they needed to start the business.  Before starting this business, [Leticia] had sold clothing, but that business was not in her best interest.

She runs the business out of her home, where she attends to the customers and her husband delivers the tables and tablecloths in his van.  She considers her business to be very important because it provides the money for their major expenses, as well as for their daily ones.  The biggest challenge is in servicing large contracts because it is a lot of work.

They are proud that their business is recommended more and more as time passes, and people come from all around, even from other towns, to rent from them.  A special moment for her was when they bought their first tables and chairs to rent out.  They used them for their three year old son’s birthday party.

She tells us that her business is popular because, even though people come from far away, they give good service at good prices.  One of the problems they face is that sometimes the customers lose the items and they have to charge them.  They don’t have any competition in the local area, so it makes things easier.

She believes that in the future they will buy more items for their business; round tables and seat covers, so that they will look more presentable, and feels that she will be able to do it from the extra income facilitated by this loan.

Leticia is married and her husband works as a private English teacher.  She has two children; nine year old Sergio who attends elementary school, and three year old Cynthia.  Her husband helps by delivering and picking up the tables.  She thinks that her business is important because, even though they invested a lot of money up front, it now provides them with a good income.  She tells us that she wants to add a second floor to her home, complete with more bedrooms for their kids.  Her hopes are that they can provide an education for their children through their business and effort.

She tells us that when she gets the loan she feels very happy and committed because she knows that she needs to invest in her business, give better service to her customers, and repay her loan.  Leticia wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “It’s great that you loan the money because the interest is low and you help the businesses.”  She likes Moyotepec, the place where she lives, very much because the landscape is very peaceful, one can see many trees, and the people there raise corn and sugar cane.

loans.use: Tablecloths

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia  Domínguez  Ramírez vive en la comunidad de Moyotepec  municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 61 años de edad, estudio 2 años de la primaria. Su negocio es de venta de refresco (coca-cola, pepsi,  jarritos, etc.) y dulces. La señora Hortencia cuando inició con su negocio (hace 12 años)  Ella inició con su negocio cuando compró su primer refrigerador, decidió vender refresco, después una de sus hijas tuvo un festejo en su casa (arrullada del niño Dios) le sobraron dulces y se los dio a su mamá para que los vendiera. También uno de sus hijos que se fue a E.U. le ayudó mandándole dinero para invertir en su negocio y para construir su casa. Con la ayuda de ellos fue haciendo crecer su negocio el cual considera muy importante porque de sus ventas tiene para su manutención y no tiene que andar pidiendo dinero, además siente gran satisfacción porque el dinero que gasta es de ella y no le debe a  nadie. A ella le da orgullo que con el producto de su trabajo pudo construir el techo de losa de su casa y unos cuartitos que le ayudo a construir su esposo que es albañil.
La clientela de la señora Hortensia son principalmente sus vecinos y a la gente que va de paso, en promedio atiende de 10 a 20 clientes por día. Una problemática que ha enfrentado es el aumento de la competencia, de señoras de su localidad que también venden dulces. Las ganancias de su negocio las vuelve a invertir, además de tomar de ahí para la alimentación. Está planeando ampliar su negocio poniendo otra mesita afuera de casa y meter más productos como chicharrones, dulces y galletas. Nos menciona que otra de las dificultades que enfrenta es que en la temporada de frío bajan las ventas de refresco, pero comenta que es en esta temporada cuando le ayudan los préstamos de KIVA, para sacar adelante su negocio en lo que se mejoran las ventas.
Tiene tres hijos: Gabriela de 37 años, Teresa de 32 años e Isaías de 23 años. Sus hijas le ayudan le dan dinero para invertirlo en el negocio cuando pueden. Considera que su negocio le ha ayudado mucho porque cuando sus hijas estudiaban ella les daba para el pasaje y para sus gastos de la escuela. Los planes que tiene a futuro son acabar bien el baño de su casa y la cocina ponerle losa, además de poner un fregadero adentro de su cocina, para no tener que salir al patio sobre todo en la época de frío. Se siente feliz de recibir su préstamo porque para ella representa una gran ayuda para poder salir adelante por sí sola, además comenta que ella no ha quedado mal en ningún ciclo. Algo que la señora Hortensia quiere comentarle a la gente de KIVA es: “le agradezco mucho que me dan esta ayuda, ya que me aligera en temporada de ventas bajas”.
texts.en:
Hortencia Domínguez Ramírez lives in Moyotepec neighborhood, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 61 years old and studied two years at elementary school.  Her business is selling soft drinks (Coca Cola, Pepsi, Jarritos, etc.) and candy.

Hortencia started her business 12 years ago.  She started her business when she bought her first refrigerator.  She decided to sell soft drinks after one of her daughters held a religious celebration in her home.  She had candy left over and she gave it to her mother to sell.  Also, one of her children who went to the United States helped her, sending her money to invest in her business and to build her house with.  With their help, she grew her business which she considers very important because her sales provide her with enough money to support herself and she doesn't have to go asking for money.  She also feels great satisfaction because the money she spends is hers and she doesn't owe anybody anything.  She is proud of the fact that, through her work, she has been able to tile her house roof and she has been able to build some small rooms that her husband, who is a builder, helped her with.

Hortensia's customers are mainly her neighbors and people who pass by.  She serves, on average, 10 to 20 customers a day.  One problem that she  has faced is the increase in competition from the ladies in her town who also sell candy.  Hortensia re-invests her profits back into her business, as well as using some to pay for food.  She is planning to expand her business, putting another table outside her house and stocking more products such as cracklings (pork scratchings), candies and cookies.  She tells us that another difficulty she faces is that, during the cold season, she doesn't sell as many soft drinks.  However, she says that it is during this season that KIVA loans help her to get ahead in her business, improving her sales.

Hortensia has three children: 37 year-old Gabriela, 32 year-old Teresa and 23 year-old Isaías.  Her daughters help her, giving her money to invest in her business whenever they can.  She considers that her business has helped her a lot because when her daughters were studying she was able to pay for their transportation and school expenses.  Hortensia's plans for the future are to finish off her bathroom and her kitchen, laying tiles.  She would also like to install a sink in her kitchen so that she doesn't have to go out to the yard, especially during the cold season.  She feels happy to be receiving this loan because, for her, it represents a great help in getting herself ahead in life on her own.  She also tells us that she has never had problems making her repayments.  Hortensia has a message for KIVA lenders: "I am very grateful that you are giving me this help since it lightens my burden during the season when sales are low".

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana Rodríguez V. se encuentra localizada en la comunidad de Ahuehueyo, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. ella tiene 38 años de edad , estudio hasta el 3er. Año de la secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Roberto Carlos tiene 21 años de edad  es casado y trabaja, Marco Antonio tiene 16 años de edad y trabaja y Bryan tiene 10 años de edad estudia la primaria, la señora Adriana tiene su negocio de venta de pollo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar pollo, ella  inicio su negocio hace 7 años por necesidades ya que con el dinero que entraba de su esposo no alcanzaba, el local donde vende esta en el centro y lo renta paga muy poco de renta al ayudante, comenzó vendiendo al realizo le dejaban el pollo en la mañana y en la tarde lo pagaba, su negocio está en centro de Ahuehueyo a 2 cuadras de su casa llega caminando, su negocio es importante porque de ahí vive con su familia, la parte favorita de su negocio es cuando hay venta porque tiene dinero y le da gran satisfacción y orgullo poder salir adelante, cuando puede comprar lo que sus hijos le piden. Sus clientes son sus amigas, sus vecinas, las señoras, las muchachas, los productos que ofrece a sus clientes son pollo por pieza o entero, bistec de pollo, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes le hacen su pedido y cuando pasan ya lo tiene listo para entregar, cuando hacen sus fiestas le apartan su pollo. Su negocio enfrenta la competencia hay mas pollerías cerca de su negocio, las ganancias las va ocupando con sus hijos, ella quiere tener un lugar para tener el pollo vivo y tener más ganancias y lo piensa logra esforzándose, su negocio le ha ayudado en lo económico para los gastos de sus hijos para que sigan estudiando, sus planes y esperanzas son crecer en su negocio, aumentar las venta y está feliz con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque le da  la oportunidad de adquirir su pollo y dar mejor servicio a los clientes, las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son que sigan estudiando que se preparen para ser alguien importante y lo piensa lograr apoyándose en el préstamo utilizarlo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana Rodríguez V. is located in the community of Ahuehueyo Ayala in the state of Morelos, México.  She is 38 years old and finished third grade of middle school; she has her certificate.  She’s married and has three children: Roberto Carlos, 21, who is married and works, Marco Antonio, who is 16 and works, and Bryan, who is ten and goes to elementary school.

Her business is selling chicken.  She is asking for funds to buy chicken.  She started the business 7 years ago due to need because her husband’s earnings didn’t go far enough.  The locale where she sells is located downtown and she rents it; the rent se pays to the helper is low.  When she started her business she’d get the chicken in the morning and she’d have to pay for it in the afternoon.  Her business is in downtown Ahuehueyo, two blocks from home.  She walks to work.

Her business is very important to her because that’s what provides for her family.  Her favorite part of the business is when sales happen because then she has money and that gives her much satisfaction and pride for being able to get ahead, when she is able to buy the things her children ask for.

Her customers are her friends, neighbors, housewives and domestics.  The products she offers her customers are whole chickens and chicken parts, chicken filets.  Her business is popular thanks to the good customer service she provides; when the customers come by she already has their orders ready for them to pick up and when they have parties they order the chicken from her.

Her business faces competition from chicken shops nearby.  She uses the profits for her children.  She’d like to have a place to keep live chickens and earn better profits; she expects to accomplish this through hard work.

Her business has helped her economically to meet her children’s educational expenses so that they can continue in school.  Her plans and hopes are to see her business grow and increase sales.

She is happy with this loan she got because it will provide her with the opportunity to acquire her chicken and provide better customer service.

The improvements she hopes for the future are that her children stay in school so that they will prepare themselves to be people of importance some day and she aims to accomplish this with help from the loan she’ll use for her business.

loans.use: To buy live chickens and at wholesale to sell whole or in pieces.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.ru:
Ramiz G. rodilsya v 1955 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , odin iz kotorix uchitsya v kolledje. Ramiz jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. 
Ramiz uje 17 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom. eto uje vtoraya ssuda Ramiza , posle pervoy ssudi on pochinil svoyu mashinu i prodav yeyo kupil druquyu mashinu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini.

http://www.kiva.org/lend/67095
texts.en:
Ramiz G. was born in 1955. He is married and has two children, one of whom is studying in college. Ramiz lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and children.

Ramiz has been in this business for seventeen years. This is the second loan for Ramiz, and after the first one he repaired his vehicle and sold it and bought a new car. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi, married with two daughters, lives in Novomokovsk and earns his living offering cargo transportation services in Ukraine. Vitalyi’s business has been impacted by developments in the farming industry. Rich harvests have been keeping him busy as he travels all around the country with a variety of freight. Vitalyi’s net profit amounts to 6,000 UAH a month.

Vitalyi owns two vans and is requesting a loan of 9,000 UAH to do some repair work on his vehicles. Properly operating vans will help him perform his work more efficiently, wasting less fuel and lubricants. Vitalyi is hoping to generate additional income to help his daughter pay for her college tuition.

loans.use: To repair his vehicles

loans.name: Nadjiba

texts.ru:
Nadjiba S.  45 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v universitete. On jivet v qorode Baku vmeste s mujem i rebonkom. 
Nadjiba seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazin chtobi ona moqla pomestit tuda bolshe  raznix tovarov. Nadjiba uje 15 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji pishevix produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey teti.
texts.en:
Nadjiba S. is 45 years old. She is married and has one child who goes to university. She lives in the city of Baku together with husband and child.

Nadjiba needs 2000 AZN right now to expand the space in her store so that she can include more produce there. Nadjiba has been doing this business selling food products for fifteen years now. She has learned this business from her aunt.

loans.use: То еxpand store space

loans.name: Baba

texts.ru:
Baba B. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 1 rebonka. Baba jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. Semya u Babi bila bednoy i poetomu on s malix let nachal rabotat. 
Baba uje 9 let rabotayet taxistom, Ranshe on rabotal prodavcom v magazine. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyye mashini.
texts.en:
Baba B. is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. Baba lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and child. Baba's family was poor and this is why he started working since a very young age.

Baba has been working as a taxi driver for nine years. Before that he was working as a sales person in a store. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 15 años empezó a trabajar como comerciante informal y después empezó a vender lotería y frutas con su esposa pero para obtener más dinero comenzó a trabajar en “Tía” (supermercado).  

Hace 5 años atrás con esfuerzo y dedicación decidió tener su propio negocio e independizarse comprando una tienda. Por esa buena decisión en la actualidad el tiene una tienda de víveres donde vende legumbres a $ 0.25c/u, lácteos $ 0.60, bebidas $ 0.50, arroz, etc. Trabaja desde las 04h30am cuando va a comprar los víveres hasta las 06h00 que abre la tienda hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.   
 
Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo enlatados, granos, bebidas y otros víveres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un vehiculo para poder transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
José, 45, is a hard working man who started working as an informal merchant 15 years ago.  He then started selling lottery tickets and fruit with his wife.  However, in order to earn more money, he started working at “Tía” (supermarket).

Thanks to his effort and dedication five years ago he decided to open his own business and become independent buying a store.  That good decision has led to his having a grocery store today where he sells vegetables at $0.25 each, dairy products at $0.60, soft drinks at $0.50, rice, etc.  He is open from 4:30am which is when he goes to buy foodstuffs and then opens the store at 6am and works until 8pm every day.

To stay in business he wants to use the loan to buy canned goods, grains, beverages and other foodstuffs for his store.  In the future he’d like to have a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: For canned goods, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Jose de 46 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde que se quedo sin trabajo ha buscado medios de ingresos como lo hizo hace 5 años atrás vendiendo colas en vaso. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio ha trabajado en la ventana de su casa vendiendo algunos víveres a sus vecinos poco a poco ha podido surtir y convertirla en una pequeña tienda. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm vendiendo bebidas desde $ 0.30, confites desde $ 0.25, agua desde $ 0.30etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para continuar con su negocio y surtirlo por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, bebidas y recargas celulares para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket porque en el sector donde vive no hay.
texts.en:
José, 46, is a hard working man who has been looking for ways to earn income since he lost his job like he did five years ago selling colas by the glass.

Living in an urban zone called Suburbio he has worked selling foodstuffs from his house’s window to his neighbors.  Gradually he has managed to stock it and turn it into a small store.  He currently is open from 7am until 10pm selling soft drinks for $0.30, sweets from $0.25, water from $0.30, etc.

He has many hopes for staying in business and stocking it.  This is why he wants the loan: to buy clothes, beverages and cell phone recharges for his customers.  In the future he’d like to have a minimarket because there is none in the area where he lives.

loans.use: For recharges, beverages and clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yadira es una pequeña comerciante en venta de ropa nueva, usada, y alquiler de cuarto. Lleva varios años en el negocio, iniciando con poca mercadería, con dinero que su esposo dio.
Luego nace la iniciativa de mejorar un cuarto para alquiler lo que recurre al financiamiento para hacer las mejoras. Lo que logra tener mejores ingresos. Para apoyar a su familia. 
Este es su séptimo ciclo de préstamo en donde invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como: pantalones jean de varón y mujer, ropa de niños, camisas, camisetas ropa interior, ya que tiene poco inventario y desea tener mejores ingresos atreves de las ventas de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Yadira is a small businesswoman who sells new and used clothes and rents out a room.  She has been in her business for several years, starting with just a little merchandise that she bought with some money her husband gave her.  Then she got the idea of improving a room so that she could rent it out, taking out a loan to make the improvements.  This way she has better profits and can support her family.

This is Yadira's seventh loan and she will invest it in buying new clothes such as men's and women's jeans, children's clothes, shirts, t-shirts and underwear since she doesn't have much inventory and she would like to improve her income through her sales.

loans.use: To invest in buying various items of clothing and underwear for men and women, increasing her sales

loans.name: Mercurio Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “MERCURIO” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro  Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  A la cabeza se encuentra la señora presidenta Ana Maria, seguida de la tesorera la señora Beatriz y la secretaria de Actas la señora Silvia.  Los negocios que llevan adelante cada una de estas señoras son diferentes, por ejemplo tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de chicharrón de pollo, venta de pollo, venta de juguetes, costura de chamarras y trabajo en carpintería.

En el caso del negocio de la señora presidenta, su negocio es la venta de ropa.  Ella ya tiene experiencia en el ramo, más de cuatro años vendiendo ropa, cuenta con un puesto fijo en la Zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.  Este es su primer ciclo, por lo que la señora Ana María considera que el crédito le servirá para incrementar la mercadería.
texts.en:
The Mercurio Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in the Germán Busch regional office.  The bank is comprised of eight members.

Ana Maria is at the head of the group, and she is the president.  Beatriz is the treasurer, and Silvia is the secretary.  

These women carry out different business activities.  Examples of their activities are selling clothes, selling deep-fried chicken, selling chicken, selling toys, making jackets, and doing carpentry work.

The president sells clothes.  She already has experience in this field, as she has been selling clothes for over four years.  She has a fixed stand in the Ballivián Zone in the city of El Alto.

This is her first cycle, and Ana María will use the loan to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Adolfo de 40 años y de sus 3 pequeños hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta empeñosa dama se dedica a la venta de fruta en el puesto que tiene en el mercado, pues su esposo es agricultor en la selva del país y ella viaja dos veces al mes para  traer la fruta que vende en su puesto. Además comercializa fruta en las casas de sus clientes que le piden, de esta manera asegura las ventas; le gusta mucho su labor pues es bastante rentable lo que le permite ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Así pasan los días de Norma que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo pues quiere sacar a su familia adelante; y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar la variedad de fruta que vende, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando para crecer empresarialmente. Norma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varias cajas para trasladar la fruta que comercializara, de esta manera espera cumplir con todos sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Norma, age 33, lives in her own house with her 40 year old husband, Adolfo, and their three small children.  Together they put forth great effort every day in order to get ahead.

This hard-working woman sells fruit in a stand that she has at the market.  Her husband farms in the country’s forest.  She travels twice a month to get the fruit that she sells at her stand.  She also sells fruit at the homes of customers who place orders.  This way she is assured of sales.

She really likes her work because it is profitable enough, and it allows her to help her husband with the regular household expenses.  This is how Norma spends her days; she works with great effort because she wants to get her family ahead.  

As she is an enterprising woman, she has future plans to increase the variety of fruit that she sells.  She wants to do this to improve her earnings.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible.  It will allow her to continue working in order to grow in her business.  Norma plans to use the requested loan to buy various boxes to transport the fruit that she sells.  This is the way she plans to fill all of her orders.

loans.use: Buy boxes of fruit for retail sales

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es:
Gioconda es una madre muy dedicada al trabajo para lograr apoyar a su familia. Hoy en día su negocio es la venta de tortilla y ropa.
Iniciando con poco dinero con una pequeña pulpería, en donde no logro equilibrar su negocio, lo que cambio. A la  venta de tortilla así como la venta de ropa.
Pues no  ha sido fácil ya que su objetivo ha sido obtener ingreso ya que  su familia es mucha.
Lleva dos créditos con la institución, los cual ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago, en donde con este nuevo crédito  será para la compra variada de ropa nueva, a si como uniforme de colegios ya que se aproxima la fecha de los estudiantes lo que aprovechara a vender.a si como la producccion mas de tortillas.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a mother who is very committed to her work so that she can support her family.  Her current business is selling tortillas and clothes.  She started out with a little money and a small grocery store.  However, she couldn't manage to balance her business and therefore changed it.  Now she sells tortillas and clothes.

It has not been easy for Gioconda since her goal has been to make money as she has a large family.

Gioconda has had two loans with the institution and she has been responsible in making her repayments.  She will use this new loan to buy a variety of new clothes as well as school uniforms since the back-to-school season is approaching and she will take advantage of this to make sales.  She will also produce more tortillas.

loans.use: To invest in buying clothes and uniforms so that she can improve her sales.  To increase her tortilla production

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja y de sus dos pequeños hijos; cada día se esfuerza por continuar adelante. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida en un paradero de la zona por donde vive. Ella saca su parrilla todos los días a las 4 de la tarde y empieza con la venta de pedazos de pollo, y corazón de res que cocina a la parrilla en el momento; y el tiempo le ha permitido captar varios clientes, sobretodo trabajadores de las líneas del paradero pues le consumen porque saben de su buena sazón y precios. Lo que no le gusta del trabajo es que por la zona tiene bastante competencia de venta de comida, por lo que debe esmerarse bastante en la buena presentación y los precios de las parrillas. Como es una mujer que siempre se proyecta al futuro tiene pensado instalar un restaurante, donde ofrezca todos variedad de platillos, de esta manera espera salir adelante. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Adela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que le hacen falta para continuar preparando sus platillos, ya que quiere aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Adela, age 36, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two small children.  She puts forth great effort every day to continue getting ahead.  For four years this enterprising woman has been selling food at a bus stop in the zone where she lives.  At four every afternoon she takes her grill and starts selling pieces of chicken and beef heart.  She cooks them on the grill at the bus stop.  Time has allowed her to win various customers, mostly the workers of the bus lines at the stop.  They eat her food because they know it tastes good and for the prices.

What she does not like about her work is that there is plenty of competition selling food in the area.  Therefore, she needs to take great care in the good presentation and the prices of the grilled food.  As she is a woman who always plans for the future, she plans to establish a restaurant where she would offer all types of dishes.  This is the way she hopes to get ahead.

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible.  The loan allows her to continue working as she seeks to make progress.  Adela plans to use the requested loan to buy wholesale ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes.  She wants to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy wholesale ingredients to continue making food

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa C. R. vive en la localidad de Moyotepec, del municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, estudio la educación básica. Su crédito lo va a utilizar para incrementar el inventario de su negocio, ella Inició su negocio hace dos años en la casa donde vive su hermana hay una cancha de fut-bol en la  colonia Abelardo y los jugadores llegaban a preguntar si vendía agua o refrescos, Entonces decidió poner un puesto con una inversión pequeña, comenzó a vender agua y refrescos, El espacio que ocupa actualmente se lo prestó su hermana esta  a un lado del campo de fut-bol de la colonia Abelardo, abre los días sábado y domingo y a veces sus sobrinos le ayuda a atender el negocio entre semana
Antes de dedicares a la venta de abarrotes vendió zapatos por catalogo pero esta actividad no le gusto porque tenía que caminar mucho, y en su negocio esta más descansada, ella va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, botellas de agua, botanas, jugos y dulces que es lo que más vende. Para trasladarse a  su negocio ella se hace 10 min. En transporte público. Considera muy importante su negocio pues de su trabajo obtiene las ganancias suficientes para su manutención además le da gran satisfacción ser la administradora de su propio negocio, además de que a través de su negocio conoce a mucha gente y todos la tratan con respeto. En su negocio atiende principalmente a los jugadores y sus familias, a los aficionados que van a presenciar los partidos. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta en su negocio es la creciente competencia lo que ha hecho que disminuyan sus ventas. Las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para invertir en más producto para su negocio, además de pagar los servicios de su negocio y su hogar. Dentro de sus planes esta comprar productos diferentes  a los que vende para tener más variedad en su negocio. Dentro de sus planes a futuro esta establecer en forma s u negocio como una tienda de abarrotes e incrementar el número de clientes.
La señora Tomasa es casada, su esposo es albañil, tiene 3 hijas: Rubí de 17 años, Yesica de 22 años y Jazmín de 20 años, como sus dos hijas están casadas y se dedican al hogar no le pueden ayudar en su negocio y su hija más chica estudia. A veces le  ayuda su sobrino a despachar entre semana  y el sábado y domingo ella atiende personalmente a la clientela. Moyotepec es un pueblo tranquilo, hay campo. La señora Tomasa quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradezco que pueden ayudarnos con este préstamo para mejorar los negocios”
texts.en:
Tomasa C. R. lives in the Moyotepec community in the city of Ayala in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 42 years old, and she has an elementary school education.  She will use the loan to increase the inventory in her business.  She started her business two years ago in her sister’s house.  There is a soccer field in the Abelardo neighborhood, and the players asked if she sold water or soft drinks.  

She then decided to make a small investment to establish a stand, and she started to sell water and soft drinks.  Her sister lent her the space that she currently uses.  It is on the side of the soccer field in the Abelardo neighborhood.  She opens it on Saturdays and Sundays.  Sometimes her sister’s children help her take care of the business during the week. 

 Before she sold food she sold shoes by catalog.  She did not like this business activity very much because she had to walk a lot, and in her new business she is not as tired.  She is going to use the loan to buy soft drinks, bottles of water, snacks, juice, and sweets.  She sells these the most.  It takes her ten minutes using public transportation to get to her business.

She feels that her business is very important because her work gives her enough income for her living expenses.  In addition, it gives her great satisfaction to run her own business.  Also, through her business she knows a lot of people, and they all treat her respectfully.

In her business she primarily waits on the players, their families, and the fans that go to the games.  One of the challenges that her business faces is the growing competition, which has caused her sales to drop.  She uses the income from her business to invest in more products for her business.  She also pays for the utilities at her business and her home.

She plans to buy different products than the ones she sells in order to have more variety in her business.  Her future plans are to set up her business like a grocery store and to increase the number of customers she has.

Tomasa is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  They have three daughters.  Rubí is 17 years old, Yesica is 22 years old, and Jazmín is 20 years old.  As two of her daughters are married, they keep house and are not able to help in her business.  Her youngest daughter goes to school.  Sometimes her nephew helps her take care of the business during the week.  On Saturday and Sunday she personally takes care of the customers.  

Moyotepec is a peaceful village with fields.

Tomasa wants to say thanks to Kiva and to the Fundación Realidad, “I am grateful to those who are able to help us improve our businesses with this loan.”

loans.use: To buy soft drinks like Coca-Cola, Pepsi, Jarrito, Squirt, Mirinda, and bottles of  purified water and sweets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 38 años, vive en la casa de su madre al lado de ella y de sus  2 hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, de manera ambulatoria, en las calles de un paradero muy concurrido. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues la desempeña de lunes a sábado, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, y tiene muy buenas ganancias por lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Además se dedica a la venta de ropa, que deja a crédito, y también comercializa útiles escolares; dice que su labor es por temporadas, es por esta razón que no tiene un trabajo estable. Solo le disgusta que tiene que soportar las inclemencias del tiempo, y durante la temporada de invierno comercializa trozos de caña de azúcar que ella misma fabrica en unas bolsas, de esta manera siempre esta en busca de ganar dinero para sustentar a su familia. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio fijo para lograr sacar a su familia adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Elizabeth tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera concretarlos para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 38, lives in her mother’s house with her mother and her two minor children.  Together they put forth great effort every day to get ahead in the search for progress.  This enterprising woman sells soft drinks in an itinerant manner.  She sells on the streets of a very busy bus stop.  

She is very satisfied with her work.  She works from Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has very good earnings, and she has managed to get her family ahead.  She also sells clothes on credit, and she sells school supplies.  Her work is seasonal, which is why she does not have stable work.

The only thing she does not like is having to put up with inclement weather.  During the winter season she sells pieces of sugar cane in bags that she makes herself.  She is always looking for ways to earn money to support her family.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to establish a steady business in order to manage to get her family ahead.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in the search of progress.  Elizabeth plans to use the requested loan to buy clothing merchandise because she has several pending orders.  She plans to fill them in order to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Stock up on more clothing to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Ignacio; El socio tiene 46 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 4 hijos; el socio trabaja como moto taxista; el socio brinda el servicio de moto taxi en la provincia de Urubamba, el socio acondicionó su moto a una especie de carreta llamada moto taxi, el vehículo transporta pasajeros de tramos cortos, el socio manifiesta que le va muy bien y que desearía tener una flota de este tipo de transporte público, por el momento el socio requiere el préstamo para arreglar su casa, el socio hará unos acabados en su sala y baño principal, el socio también cubrirá una pequeña deuda que adquirió por concepto de un regalo que le compro a su conyugue. El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar un acabado en su hogar específicamente la sala y baño.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a member of “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA” (Urubamba’s New Dawn) communal bank which is located in Urubamba province, Cusco department.

He is 46 years old, has a spouse and four children.  He works as a taxi driver.  He provides mototaxi services in Urubamba province.  He modified his motorcycle adding a type of cabin called a mototaxi.  The vehicle transports passengers on short runs.  He states that he does quite well and would like to have a fleet of these kinds of public transportation vehicles. 

For the moment, however, he needs a loan to do some home improvements.  He will do some work in the living room and bathroom.  He will also pay off a debt he incurred buying a gift for his spouse.  He is asking for the loan to do some finishing touches in his home, specifically in the living room and bathroom.

He is happy with the granted loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To do some home improvements, specifically in the living room and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Efrain; El socio tiene 31 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 14 años de edad; el socio trabaja en su carpintería, el es carpintero y tiene también su moto taxi  de vez en cuando el maneja su transporte, el socio trabaja con su hermano y el hermano del socio es el que maneja su moto taxi y él se dedica  a la carpintería, es como si le rentara el vehículo, el socio ahora solicita el préstamo porque desea invertir en la compra de madera para su carpintería el socio tiene unos pedidos y requiere la madera para empezar a trabajar. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera para su carpintería.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Efraín, 31, is a member of the “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA” (Urubamba’s New Dawn) communal bank located in Urubamba province, Cusco department.

He lives with his spouse and two children who are 3 and 14 years old.  He works in his carpentry shop.  He is the carpenter but he also has his mototaxi which he himself drives sometimes to provide transportation.  He works with his brother and his brother is the usual mototaxi driver whereas Efraín works as a carpenter; it’s as if he rented his vehicle to his brother.

He now needs a loan because he wants to invest in lumber for his carpentry shop; he has a few pending orders and he needs lumber in order to start on the jobs.  He is asking for the loan to buy lumber for his carpentry shop.

He is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Madeline Jissell

texts.es:
Madeline de 25 años de edad, casada madre de un hijo. Labora como analista de unidad técnica coordinadora de proyectos en una empresa privada.
Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en publicidad. Juntos han logrado tener su casa y como objetivo es ir mejorando. Con este préstamo lograra poner cerámica en toda su casa, ya que el piso está muy viejo y parte quebrada.
Para esto comprara cerámica, cemento bond, porcelana, separadores para poner en ciento veinte metros cuadrados de su vivienda. Lo que está contenta por este cambio y por el apoyo financiero a plazo que brinda Afodenic.
texts.en: Madeline is 25 years old, married and has one child.  She works as a technical unit analyst - project coordinator in a private company.  She has the support of her husband who works in advertising.  Together they have managed to obtain their own home and their aim is to gradually improve it.  They will use this loan to put down tiles throughout their home since the floor is very old and broken in places.  For this work they will buy tiles, cement, porcelain and separators so that they can lay down twenty square meters in their home.  Madeline is happy to be making this change and happy with the financial support she is receiving through this loan from Afodenic.

loans.use: To put down tiles throughout her home, managing to make this improvement since the floor is very old and broken in places.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Alejandro; El socio tiene 36 años de edad, el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en su zapatería, el socio tiene una zapatería ya que él es zapatero de profesión, el socio vende zapatos y también los repara, su conyugue lo ayuda en su zapatería ellos también venden plantillas, escobillas, tintes, grasas y otros materiales de zapatería y accesorios. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para fabricar zapatos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para fabricar zapatos para esta temporada.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Nuevo Amanacer de Urubamba communal bank  which is located in Urubamba province in Cusco department.

He is Alejandro, 36, married, with two children. A shoemaker by profession, he works in a shoe store where he sells and also repairs shoes.  His wife helps him in the store and they also sell insoles, brushes, dyes, shoe polish and other related items and accessories.  Alejandro needs the loan to buy materials to make shoes and that is why he is requesting the loan for this season.

He is very happy with the loan extended to him and he promises to make all the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy material to make shoes for this season

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio U. M. es casado y tiene tres hijos a su responsabilidad quienes  son: maría Angélica de trece  año, la  otra es Blanca Estela de  once años y el más pequeño Ignacio de siete años.

       El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta  de becerros  y vacas para  luego venderlo en  la misma región ya que es un negocio de buen resultado  dejando buen ingreso en su familia

       Inicio por su propia creatividad ya que  para tener ingresos en su hogar tiene que tener de donde trabajar  algo que le dejara buen resultado  y con ello salga adelante.

       Con las ganancias que  baya obteniendo lo estar a  invirtiendo  en la compra  de mas veceros para seguir trabajando durante dios le preste vida y así logre realizar todos su sueños.

      Su sueño  es que sus hijos salgan delante  teniendo una buena preparación  y de ello puedan vivir en el futuro ya que la mejor herencia es que tengan una buena profesión.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio U. M. is married and has three children in his care.  They are: María Angélica, 13, Blanca Estela, 11, and the youngest, Ignacio, 7.

He requested a loan to invest in the purchase of calves and cows for subsequent resale in the same region since this is a business that produces good results consisting in income for his family.

He started out thanks to his own creativity since in order to have household income he must have a way of working at something that produces good results in order to get ahead.

He will reinvest profits as they are earned in the purchase of additional calves to continue working as long as God grants him life thus making his dreams come true.

His dream is that all his children succeed having a good preparation so that they can support themselves in the future since the best inheritance a parent can give is a good profession.

loans.use: To buy livestock, like cows and calves, for subsequent resale in the same region.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores L. H. vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con tres hijas a su responsabilidad y son: Tania Guadalupe de 12 años, gloria Melisa de cuatro años  y el más pequeño es Jesús Abey de tres años.

        Ella esta se dedica a vender la mercancía de topear ware en donde lleva  diez años y desde entonces le va muy bien ya que ha obtenido mucha clientela del cual le compra a mayoreo, ya que s  mercancía de buena calidad y  la apetecen.

        De todo lo que va obteniendo del diario lo ahorra, pues su inspiración es que logre ser una gerentes de ventas en  los artículos  delo que ella vende y así salir adelante con su familia.

      Su más grande sueño es que con el tiempo logre su meta de ser una ejecutiva de ventas y poner  su propio negocio del cual se siente muy orgullosa de ellos pues le ha dejado muy buen resultado.
   
      Para solicitar el préstamo busco informacion del programa, le pareció muy bueno y es así como hoy es parte del crédito que otorga fundación realidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores L. H. lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, México.  She’s married and has three children in her care.  They are: Tania Guadalupe, 12, Gloria Melisa, 4, and the youngest, Jesús Abey, 3.

She has been selling Tupperware merchandise for ten years.  She has done very well all this time because she has acquired many customers who buy from her at wholesale because her merchandise is very good quality and well received.

She saves everything she earns daily because her inspiration is to become a Sales Manager for the type of merchandise she sells and thus get ahead with her family.

Her greatest dream is to become a Sales Executive in time and set up her own business of which she can be proud because she’s had good results to date.

To request the loan she sought information about the programs.  She thought it was very good and that’s how today she’s part of the loan Fundación Realidad grants.

loans.use: To buy Tupperware products.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es:
Wendy de profesión enfermera, habita en casa de sus padres en donde ha venido haciendo su propio cuarto para lograr tener mejor privacidad. Hoy en día labora en un  hospital desde hace seis año está ejerciendo su oficio.
Y con financiamiento de la institución ha logrado en su amplitud la construcción de su cuarto aparte. En donde con este nuevo crédito lo hará un poco más grande en donde comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra. Contenta porque se ha hecho posible mediante estos cinco ciclos de préstamos la mejora de su casa ya que ante era toda de madera y los cincos ciclos han sido solo para infraestructura
texts.en:
Wendy, a nurse, lives at her parents' house, where she has had a separate apartment built in order to have more privacy. She works at a hospital and has been a nurse for six years. 

With funding from AFODENIC she has managed to build her separate apartment. She will use this new loan to buy additional building materials and start the necessary works to extend it. 

She is happy because with the five cycles of loans she has managed to improve the infrastructure of her home, which used to be all wood.

loans.use: Buy building materials to extend her apartment.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina U. M., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera  en donde tuvo dos hijos quienes ya están casados, con ella viven dos nietos que están estudiando y que son hijos de la señora Marbella.

        Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de ingredientes para elaboración de tamales que viene practicando desde hace tiempo y cometa que hasta el momento le va muy bien con este pequeño trabajo.

        En esta actividad se inspiro ya que para sacar adelante a sus hijos tenía que tener en donde de dicar su tiempo y tener de donde provenir sus ingresos para cubrir sus pequeños gastos generados en su hogar.

        Con la ganancia que va obteniendo  comprar  más ingredientes que se le terminan cuando helos elabora al mayoreo  y le agotan, de eso mismo  obtiene para ser puntal en sus pagos que se dan en el préstamo.

        Su sueño es que logre comprar materiales para mandar a repellar su casa, como también  seguir trabando  hasta que dios le preste vida y con ellos salir adelante en estos tiempos.
texts.en:
Señora Marcelina U. M. lives in Tecpatan in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is a single mother with two children that are married.  She has two school-age grandchildren that live with her and are the children of Señora Marbella.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make tamales. She has been making tamales for some time now and says that so far things are going well. She was drawn to this activity because, in order to help her children get ahead, she needed to find a way to use her time to earn the income needed to pay her minor household expenses..  With the earnings she obtains she will buy more ingredients because she runs out when she makes large quantities of tamales.  She will also use her earnings to make her loan payments on time.  

Her dream is to be able to buy materials to plaster her house as well as to also continue working for as long as God grants her life and to get ahead in these times.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Marbella

texts.es:
La señora Marbella Rodríguez U., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  con el señor Edin Morales Gutiérrez, en   el cual procreo cuatro hijos una mujer y tres varones y son: Marbella de dieciocho años, el segundo es  Luis Antonio de trece  años, el otro es Amilsi de siete y el más pequeño es Edin de dos años y medio.

       Se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes con el cual acaba de iniciar hace unos meses,  comenta que le va bien, pues de ahí obtiene para  sus  ingresos de su  hogar y tambien para la educación de sus hijos que estudian.

       En esta actividad inicio por si sola ya que en el barrio donde ella vive las tiendas están retiradas y se les dificulta ir a comprar sus cosas hasta el centro y mejor decidió poner su propia tienda  donde sus vecinos tambien le con suman.

       Con la ganancia que va obteniendo, de su venta lo invierte comprando más mercancía, así surtir  de nuevo su tienda y obtenga mejores ventas  e ingresos en su hogar, pues cuado menos tenga para sostenerse con su familia que para ella es muy importante.

      Su  sueño más grande es lograr que su negocio  aumente  y de ello trabajar para  obtener  dinero del cual pueda ahorrar y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando y con  eso tenga para terminar una profesión.
texts.en:
Señora Marbella Rodríguez U. lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to señor Edin Morales Gutiérrez with whom she has four children, one girl and three boys: Marbella (18), Luis Antonio (13), Amilsi (7), and the youngest Edin (2½). Marbella runs a grocery store which she opened just a few months ago. She says that all is going well, and she is earning money to pay for household expenses and her children’s education.

In the neighbourhood where Marbella lives, the only shops are a distance away so she has to go into the town centre to do her shopping. For this reason she decided it was a good idea to open her own store where her neighbours can also do their shopping.

With the loan she plans to buy more stock for her store so that she can sell more, earn more, and provide for her family--something that is very important to her. Marbella’s greatest dream is to see the store do well so that she can save money and support her children while they are students. Then they will be able to get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, beans, oil, cookies

loans.name: Orlando Adan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Orlando; El socio tiene 44 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 3 hijos; el socio trabaja prestando servicio de moto taxi, el socio tiene un vehículo de servicio público el socio maneja la moto taxi diario y todo lo que ahorra le sirve para culminar de construir su casa, el socio ahora requiere le préstamo para comprar algunos muebles para el hogar, el comprara un mueble para colocar el televisor, la radio y ubicarlo en su sala comedor, el socio trabaja mucho y ahora se encuentra en descanso reunido con su grupo para hacer su requerimiento, el nos manifiesta que con lo que siga generando su trabajo con la moto taxi el pagara sus cuotas y con el resto seguirá implementando sus habitaciones. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un mueble para la sala comedor.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Orlando is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer Community Bank of Urubamba located in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He earns his living driving a motor taxi. Everything he saves goes towards finishing his house.

Now Orlando needs a loan to buy furniture. He plans to buy a stand for the television and radio and put it in the dining room. He is a hard worker currently on his day off. He tells us that he continues to get work through the taxi business and that he will pay back the money he borrows. With part of the money he also plans to furnish other rooms.

Orlando is pleased to be able to obtain a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karin; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende diferentes tipos de ropa como pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, por medio de este negocio la asocia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tiednda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Karin is a member of the URPI Community Bank located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. She is 38 years old, married, and has a son. As well as looking after the household, she has a business selling different types of clothing such as pants, sweaters, t-shirts, and blouses. With the money she earns she supports her family. Now Karin wants to open a clothes store. For this she needs a loan to buy items of clothing at wholesale prices.

Karin is pleased to be able to obtain a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar Danilo es un hombre muy trabajador, casado, como meta ha sido la construcción de su casa. Ya que cuenta con una familia y quiere tener lo propio, ya que donde vive es donde sus padres.
Hoy en día esta laborando en mantenimiento en una bodega de una empresa privada. Y ha tenido varios trabajos.  Tiene ya el comienzo bastante avanzada su pequeña casa en donde lo está logrando con financiamiento de Afodenic.
