Ya son cinco ciclos y todos con el mismo propósito, como sus entradas de ingresos tienen que equilibrar todos los gastos va poco a poco haciéndola. En donde con esta nueva solicitud comprara materiales de construcción como más piedra, cemento, bloques y seguir levantando las paredes.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo is a hardworking man. He is married and his goal is to build his own home, because he has a family and is currently living with his parents. He works doing maintenance work in a store owned by a private company and has had different jobs prior to that. 

He has managed to get started with the house thanks to financing from Afodenic. He has already completed five cycles, all of them with the same purpose. He balances out the revenue obtained with his expenses, building the house bit by bit. With this new loan he will buy more building materials, such as  stone, concrete and blocks, to continue to build the walls.

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as stone, concrete and blocks in order to continue to build the walls of his house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente en la clínica San Juan de Dios, ella enseña a los diferentes niños que viven en esta clínica san Juan de Dios, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Flora is 58 years old, a widow, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her work as a teacher at the San Juan de Dios Clinic, teaching the different children who live in this clinic. She wants to have a grocery store and she is requesting the loan for housing maintenance.

Flora is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Maintenance for her house

loans.name: Mayda Enriqueta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mayda Enriqueta; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente en la provincia de Quispicanchis, ella enseña a niños del nivel primario, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Mayda Enriqueta is 62 years old, married, and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with her work as a teacher in the province of Quispicanchis, teaching children in elementary school. She wants to have a grocery store and she is requesting the loan for housing maintenance.

Mayda Enriqueta is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Maintenance for her house

loans.name: Betty Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Betty Patricia; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente en la provincia de Anta y distrito de cachimayo y también se dedica al negocio de manualidades, ella vende en forma independiente y ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las manualidades.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Betty Patricia is 41 years old, single, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her work as a teacher in the Cachimayo district, within the province of Anta. She also works in the handicrafts business and sells independently and by foot. She wants to expand her handicrafts business and is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make handicrafts.

Betty Patricia is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Nelida Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelida Margot; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas en un Kiosco escolar y también se dedica al trabajo de fisioterapia en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como caramelos, chupetes y galletas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Nelida Margot is 35 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling snacks at a school kiosk, and she also works independently in physical therapy. She wants to expand her snack business and is requesting the loan to purchase snacks such as candy, lollipops and cookies.

Nelida Margot is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase snacks such as candy, lollipops and cookies.

loans.name: Cesar Alfonso

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Cesar; El socio tiene 65 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene 3 hijos, el socio compra y vende vidrios, el socio tiene una pequeña vidriería, el socio invierte su dinero en la compra de vidrios al por mayor y poco a poco el va utilizando según las medidas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vidrios al por mayor.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Minka communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Cesar is 65 years old, married, and has three children. He buys and sells glass and has a small glass store. He invests his money in the purchase of wholesale glass and uses it little by little over time. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale glass.

Cesar is happy for the loan granted and he promises to make his loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of wholesale glass

loans.name: Lucynia Yesica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucynia Yesica; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleada d seguridad y también se dedica a la venta de chocolates, la socia vende los chocolates en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes tiendas que venden chocolates, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chocolates. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chocolates al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucynia Yesica is a member of the "URPI" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lucynia Yesica is 30 years old, married and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her work as a security guard.  She also sells chocolates.  She sells chocolates in an itinerant manner, delivering her products to different stores that sell chocolates.  She would like to expand her business.

Lucynia Yesica is requesting this loan to buy chocolates wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy chocolates wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde que trabajo en una panadería comenzó a reunir dinero para tener su propio negocio ya que tenía la experiencia en hacer panes. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ha trabajado en la pequeña panadería que ahora tiene y en la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende los panes a $ 0.08 c/u, el litro de leche a $ 0.80, el queso entero a $ 2.80. Aunque trabaja sola quiere continuar con su negocio para mantener a sus 4 hijos de 11, 9, 5, 4 años. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina y un horno para poder hornear más panes y dulces y así tener más clientela. En el futuro quiere que su negocio sea más grande para tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who used to work in a bakery and started to gather together money to set up her own business since she had experience making bread.

Rosa lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  She has worked in the small bakery that she now owns and she currently works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  She sells her bread at $0.08 each, a liter of milk at $0.80 and a whole cheese at $2.80.  Although she works alone, she would like to continue in her business to support her four children aged 11, 9, 5 and 4.

Gabina is 57 years old and married. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling handicrafts in a place called La Posada del Inca. She makes her sales by foot and offers different types of handicrafts such as sweaters, blankets and silver necklaces and earrings. She wants to expand her handicrafts business and is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts.

Gabina is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales están estudiando en el colegio. Carmen, tiene un puesto ambulatorio  donde vende ropa usada y entre otros accesorios de uso. Para proveerse de mercaderías, todos los días muy temprano por la mañana acude a un mercado informal, es donde adquiere los productos que necesita. Luego organiza su negocio con mucha prisa, donde sus clientes la esperan. De esa manera viene trabajando por más de 10 años, y señala sentirse muy contenta por las utilidades que le genera. Su sueño, es alquilar  un puesto en el  mercado, para evitar ser  reubicado  constantemente. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que este dinero le será muy útil, por ello se compromete pagar puntualmente las cuotas de cada mes, para acceder posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más mercaderías y también invertirá en la compra de lencerías femeninas, para las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en: Carmen is 36 years old, lives in her own house with her husband, and has 3 children, who are studying at school. Carmen has a mobile street kiosk where she sells used clothing and accessories. In order to obtain her merchandise, every day very early in the morning she goes to an informal market where she gets the items she needs. Then she quickly organizes her business where her customers await her. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, and says she is happy to be useful. Her dream is to rent a stall in the market, and not have to constantly relocate. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she knows that this money will be very useful. She promises to make her monthly payments on time, so as to be eligible for future help. With the loan she is seeking, she will increase her merchandise and also purchase feminine lingerie to sell for the new year's parties.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and begin selling lingerie.

Yovana; ella tiene 31 años de edad, soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picantería lugar donde venden comida típica también venden chicha hecha a base de maíz, también vende cerveza, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento la socia es una persona muy alegre y con ganas de seguir adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como carne,arroz,azúcar entre otros mas para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the village bank "San Valentin".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  

Yovana is 31 years old, single, and has two children.  She has a food stall where she sells typical foods as well as chicha, a fermented corn-based beverage.  They also sell beer.  This is the only business that she currently operates.  Yovana is a very happy person and wants to get ahead.

She requests a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, sugar and other things for her business.

She is very happy because of the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, rice, sugar and other things for her business

loans.name: Charles Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Charles Victor; el tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el se dedica al transporte de turismo tiene una combi que hace servicio a turistas a las diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cusco, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio que presta a los turistas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Los Andenes” which is located in the District of Cuzco, in the Province and Department of Cuzco.

The member’s name is Charles Victor; he is 34 years old and single. The member works in transport, dedicating himself to tourism transport; he has a combi van which he uses to provide service to tourists headed to different places in the city of Cuzco. He works independently and wants to improve the service he provides tourists. 

The member requests this loan for the maintenance of his vehicle. 

The member is happy to receive this loan, and commits to making her loan payments.

loans.use: The member requests this loan for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Angel Leocadio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Angel Leocadio; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros y también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el socio atiende el negocio de venta de repuestos carros desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the village bank "Los Andenes", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Angel Leocadio is 55 years old and married with two children.  He alternates his daily activities between his business selling replacement car parts and raising guinea pigs.  He works at the car parts business from 9am until 6pm.  He wants to improve his business and is asking for a loan to buy car parts. 

He is very happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy car repair parts

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de San Sebastián. El distrito de San Sebastián se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 10 km. de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca.
Nicolás se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes en su propio taxi y trabaja en el cercado del Cusco. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios y le va regular. Nicolás y su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatorio, ellos llevan sus productos en una carreta y se instalan en la calle y venden a todos los transeúntes que pasan por esa calle. Con su próximo préstamo, Nicolás que espera recibir S/. 2300 nuevos soles. Por el momento desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, dulces, galletas, gaseosas, tortas y muchos productos más. Nicolás pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives with his wife and three children in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco and located 10km from the town square. It is also the archaeological capital of South America. Cusco is an enchanting city that dates back to the time of the Incas. The city of Cusco is built at the base of an ancient Incan village.

Nicolás provides transportation services with his own taxi and works along the outskirts of Cusco. He has been providing transportation services for many years and works on a regular basis. Nicolás and his wife also have a small business selling sweets as street vendors. They haul their products in a cart, park it on the street, and sell to everyone who passes through their location. With this next loan Nicolás will receive 2300 PEN. At the moment, he wants to increase his business capital and purchase merchandise such as candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products. Nicolás belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) Communal Bank that is part of Asociación Arariwa. The Communal Bank is in its second year of operation and is doing very well.

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products to sell

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en: Baatarsuren B. is 21 years old and lives with his parents in Hovd province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His mother is a teacher in the local school and his father operates a clothes trading business at the local market. Baatarsuren operates an Internet café in his town. He started his business in 2009 after building his own workplace next to the local market, a popular spot where he attracts many customers. He has established himself in the local business community and has a steady operation. For the future, he hopes to expand his business by selling a variety of cellphone parts. Baatarsuren is a talkative and open-minded person. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cellphone parts and tools for his business.

loans.use: to purchase cellphone parts and tools

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg B. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter attends university while the two youngest ones attend a local high school. His wife operates a clothing retail business while Erdenebileg drives a taxi in the local community. At first, he began his own business in 1998 by operating a clothes trading business. After many years of operation, he was able to start operating a taxi service to supplement his earnings. His wife is now responsible for the clothes retail business. For the future, he plans to expand his business and buy one more shipping container so they can sell a variety of clothing items. Erdenebileg is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more winter clothes and to start providing a car repair service.

loans.use: to purchase more winter clothes and to start providing a car repair service

loans.name: Batdolgor

texts.en: Batdolgor N. is 38 years old single mother and lives with her father and child in an small apartment in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends a high school. Batdolgor operates a small grocery trading business in the city. She started her grocery shop in 2008, and has built a stable operation over the years. Her business' earnings have created financial stablilty for her family. Batdolgor hopes to expand her shop into more bigger grocery shop in the future. She has a car leasing loan which is still paid of her loan. Currently she is planning to pay off her all loan and obtain an apartment leasing loan in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products to sell at her shop in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg D. is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All of their children live on their own. Uranchimeg's husband is retired and works as a guard for a local company, earning a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT. Uranchimeg operates a fuel trading business in her town. She collects dry droppings of cattle (for fuel) from the rural areas and sells those droppings at the local market once a week. Uranchimeg is a talkative and hardworking person. She needs more funds to rent a car in order to transport her products to the local market. She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to rent a car for her business.

loans.use: to rent a car for her business

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en: Enhzaya M. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own house in Bayanhoshuu, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest two daughters attend a local secondary school and his wife helps him with the business. Enhzaya owns and operates his own wooden products business, specializing in ger parts, ger furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2008, having worked as a carpenter since 2001. All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail, which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. After years of successful operation, he was able to have his own workplace in his enclosure. For the future, he plans to open a workplace in Grand Plaza, where he can attract a larger customer base. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood when prices for such items are cheap.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. Her two sons both attend a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver for the "Auto Speed Company". Gantsetseg is self-employed, making a variety of knitted and woven products in her home. She started her business in 2001 with working capital of 100,000 MNT and has built a stable operation. At first, she started her business with only one sewing machine. After many years of hard work, she managed to expand her business and today her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT with 4 sewing machines. For the future, she plans to establish her own knitted clothing factory. She also needs to hire 3 workers for her 3 sewing machines. Gantsetseg is a hardworking and modest person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics, wool yarns and a knitting machine for producing her woolen clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics, wool yarns and a knitting machine

loans.name: Chuluundolgor

texts.en:
Chuluundolgor G. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and enclosure. One of her children is a university student, three children attend a local secondary school and the oldest works as a salesperson in a grocery shop with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT. Chuluundolgor's husband is a crane mechanist and during summer months their family income has increased greatly.

Chuluundolgor operates a firewood sales business next to her home in her town. She started her business in 2006 selling her products at the local coal and firewood trading market. Her main customers are the neighboring households and she has gained a wide customer base. After years in business, she has built a stable operation. For the future, she hopes to operate a livestock and meat trading business. Chuluundolgor is a talkative and open-minded person. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and coal for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and coal

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mr. Ty P. (pictured) and his wife, Mrs. Ny Son, live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They have been married since 2001 and Ny just got pregnant.  

Mr. Ty P. is a motor taxi driver and assists his wife in their joint business when he is free.  The couple has supplemented their income with a new business of raising chickens. They are now requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Jargaltuya

texts.en:
Jargaltuya L., 31, lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her family lives together in a house with a fence.   

Jargaltuya operates her own clothing business.  She makes a variety of deels, which are traditional Mongolian coats.  She started her sewing business in 2007 with only one sewing machine.  Her business has been so successful that it has allowed her to hire a worker.  Currently, she owns two sewing machines.  She is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabric and material to make a variety of traditional clothes for the upcoming Mongolian New Year holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun P. (pictured) has been a silkweaver for over 10 years.  She is a widow with one son.  She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Her son is a construction worker and farmer.

Chanthoeun hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession and she does not want to transition into another business.  She is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase weaving materials.  A portion of her loan will be used to provide capital for her son to continue his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to provide capital for her son's farming business

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy K. and her husband, Mr. Sok Men, both 41 years old, live in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children - two sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, three have full-time employment and the youngest attends school.  

Mrs. Sophy K. has been operating a tailoring business at home for four years. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.en: Nurjan H. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and enclosure. His daughter attends a local secondary school while his wife works as a teacher for the school. Nurjan operates a raw materials trading business, using his own car, buying raw materials locally and selling them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, for a profit. He started his business in 2001 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT which soon grew to 9,000,000 MNT. He has gained a lot of experience and knowledge over the years and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing. Nurjan is a hardworking and modest person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials to sell in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn C., 44 years old, and her husband, Mr. Mean Miech, 46 years old, have 8 children - 5 sons and 3 daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Norn and her husband are rice farmers. They also operate a fishing business when they are not at the farm. Norn is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine for her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar D. is 27 years old and lives with his parents in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his parents live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

After saving money from his current job as a plumber, Otgonbayar purchased a car which enabled him to start his own transportation business in 2009 to supplement his earnings.   For the future, he plans to build a house on his fenced lot. 

Otgonbayar is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase machinery parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Santos Melania

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el caserío Collique, una zona agrícola que está habitada por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. Pertenece al distrito de Zaña y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas junto a su esposo. Ella cuenta con un pequeño de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maíz. Ambos trabajan unidos para mantener este cultivo y poder salir adelante. Sus cosechas las comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y depende de los ingresos que obtiene para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Santos desea adquirir materiales de abono para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y de ese modo pueda asegurarse una buena cosecha. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 49 year old mother who lives with her husband and one son in the village of Collique, an agricultural area that is inhabited by modest hardworking people. This community is part of the District of Zaña and located M. than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos and her husband have been farming together for ten years. She has a small plot of land where she grows corn. They both work together to maintain this crop so that they can move forward. Her harvest is sold at the wholesale market of the city of Chiclayo and she depends on her earnings so that she can stay ahead with her family’s finances.

Santos wants to acquire fertilizing supplies so that she can maintain her crop and secure a good harvest. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edypme Alternativa so that she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizing supplies to maintain her crop of corn

loans.name: Amando

texts.en:
Amando P. is from the village of Victoria San Mateo. He is 52 years old. Amando is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amando owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amando has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Amando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amando is requesting a loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Bazarhan

texts.en:
Bazarhan T. is 40 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, on a  fenced lot. His three children all attend a local secondary school. His wife operates a vegetable growing business in her town. 

Bazarhan operates a transportation business in town using his own mini truck. He started this transportation service in 2008.  He has had much success and has earned significant experience as a driver. In addition, he operates meat trading business during the autum months to supplement his earnings. He purchases livestock from herders and slaughter them to sell the meat at the local market. 

For the future, Bazarhan hopes to continue making progress with his business.  He says, "I do everything that can earn money."  He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the farming business for thirty-five years. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces milk, maize, bananas, tomatoes and sugarcane, all of which are sold locally. He is also employed as a civil servant and serves as an assistant chief in his town. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. His family will therefore be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this investment will help pay school fees for his children. 

His biggest challenges have been diseases and lack of market for his products. He would like to open a big retail shop in future.

Daniel is 49 years old and married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yumdermaa

texts.en:
Yumdermaa R. is a 47-year-old single mother who lives with her 6 children in Hovd province in Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, on a fenced lot. Her oldest son works for a security company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her next oldest sons are university students and her youngest two children attend a local secondary school. 

Yumdermaa operates a small cafe in her town. She started her own business in 2006 by operating a flour trading business. After years of operation, she has managed to establish a stable cafe business in her local community. Her earnings have enabled her not only to pay her children's tuition fees but aslo provide for her entire family. 

For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business at a stable level so that she can afford to build a house on her fenced lot, and save more money for her children's future education. She  requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of materials and supplies for her cafe in order to make a variety of meals.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad. La localidad se encuentra situada a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de pan y diversos productos en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las esquinas de la localidad en donde reside. Ella trabaja ofreciendo su mercadería generalmente por las tardes y siempre atiende a sus clientes con un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Elvira desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para adquirir mas pan y así poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old, single, and lives with her family in the District of Paiján, a commercial area that is located in Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad. This community is located more than two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elvira sells bread and different products from a mobile stand situated on a street corner in the town where she lives. She usually sells her merchandise in the afternoons and always provides good service to her customers. This business helps her family get ahead.

Elvira wants to increase her operating capital so that she can acquire more bread and satisfy the current demand. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos en su domicilio. Ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas para comercializarlos entre sus vecinos y trabajadores de la zona. El negocio ya cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento y durante este tiempo ha podido obtener una clientela fiel que prefiere sus buena sazón y buen trato. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio son una fuente importante de ingreso para la economía de su familia.

Asunciona desde adquirir insumos para ampliar su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas, su demanda ha estado aumentando y ello hace que tenga que esforzarse más para satisfacerla. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in one of the villages that make up Lambayeque district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Asunciona's business is preparing and selling food in her home.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners to sell to her neighbors and workers in the area.  She has been running her business for three years and, during this time, she has been able to attract a loyal customer base who prefer her business for the good flavor of her food and her good customer service.  The profits that she makes from this business are an important source of income for her family's finances.

Asunciona would like to acquire supplies so that she can expand her business and increase her sales.  Her demand has been increasing and this means that she has to work even harder to meet it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire supplies to expand her business and increase her sales

loans.name: Alfredy

texts.en:
Alfredy has been practicing mixed farming for the last eighteen years.  He employs 6 farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces tea, milk, maize and beans.  These are sold both locally and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also owns a posho mill in the same area. 

Alfredy is 34 years old.  He is married and has 7 children between the ages of 2 and 16.  Six of the children attend school.

Alfredy has requested this loan for 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this investment, his milk production will increase and he will earn more income. 

In this business, he faces the challenges of diseases, bad debtors and lack of proper market for his products. In five years' time, he plans to acquire more land and expand his farming from small-scale to large-scale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tolobubu's Group

texts.en:
Tolobubu J. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region.  Tolobubu, 50, is married to a security guard.  She receives a monthly salary in the amount of 2000 soms. 

A year ago with the initial investment of 15000 soms, Tolobubu started breeding livestock. She makes money by reselling the animals at a higher price after fattening them. In this manner, she earns 2000 soms per month.   With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase four livestock animals for breeding.  In the future, Tolobubu wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
The man shown in this picture is Mr. Cheam S..  He is 40 years old. He is a worker responsible for the provision of clean water in the city of Phnom Penh.  He has been working in this job since 1996 and earns approximately $2.50 a day. His wife’s name is Kunthea.  She is 38 years old and works as a seamstress. The couple is blessed with two children, one is a student in public school, and the other is a garment worker. 

Mr. Cheam S. requested a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. He will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase land to rent to farmers

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, maracuyá y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en la ganadería desde que era joven. El cuenta con vacas, las cuales cría cerca a su vivienda, las alimenta de pastos naturales y comercializa su carne y su leche entre los vecinos de la zona. También las vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar el lugar en donde reside. Adicionalmente siembra frutas. Los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia.

Pedro desea adquirir alimento balanceado para hacer que sus vacas desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan brindarle mejores ganancias. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which produces mainly fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Pedro has been working in livestock farming since he was young.  He has cows that he raises near his home.  He feeds them on natural pasture and sells their meat and milk to his neighbors in the area.  He also sells them to the traders who usually visit the place where he lives.  Pedro also grows fruit.  The income that he makes from these activities help him to get his family ahead.

Pedro would like to acquire balanced animal feed so that his cows develop in the best way possible and so that they can provide him with better profits.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed to improve his cattle raising

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya T. is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and child in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rented apartment. Her child attends a local primary school. 

Tuya operates a CD and DVD rental shop in her town with the help of her husband. They bought latest movies and songs from internet and translate those items into Mongolian and sell a variety of movies out of their rented work place. They started their business in 2004 and have built a stable operation. After years of operation, they have managed to improve their equipment and tools. They plan to expand their business by establishing a mini movie theatre with 3D technology in the future. 

Tuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the necessary tools and equipment for her future mini cinema.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora N. is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years. Her main products are maize, beans, bananas, coffee and milk – all of which she sells locally. She depends mainly on the income from her farm to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Flora recently repaid a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES.  She has requested another loan for 30,000 KES, this time to start a poultry project. The income from this investment will help educate her children and improve her family's livelihood. 

Her major challenges have been pests and diseases which affect her production, and the lack of proper markets for her products. She intends to improve her farming and open a cereals store in the future.

Flora is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 8.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Juanota Victoria

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 46 años D. edad, es viuda y resiD. junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD.,  una zona D. clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, maracuyá y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Su esposo falleció en Octubre pasado y ella ha tenido que ingeniárselas para poder salir adelante. Se mudó a una casa mas pequeña para alquilar la suya y con algunos ahorros pudo instalar una bodega en su nueva casa. Ella da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su familia y diariamente trabaja con tesón. El negocio está creciendo gracias a sus esfuerzos y actualmente cuenta con clietela fidelizada

Juanita desea adquirir mas productos para poder ampliar su nivel D. ventas y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan seguir saliendo adelante. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juanita is 46 years old, widowed, and lives with her two children in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate that mainly produces fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Juanita's husband died last October and she has had to apply her ingenuity in order to get ahead.  She moved to a smaller house so that she could rent out her own house and, with a few savings, she was able to set up a small grocery store in her new house.  Juanita gives the best of herself in order to get her family ahead and she works with determination every day.  Her business is growing thanks to her hard work and she currently has a loyal customer base.

Juanita would like to acquire more products so that she can expand her sales levels and make more profits that will allow her to continue getting ahead.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more products so that she can expand her sales levels and make more profits

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is 61 years old and a married mother of seven children who all are adults. Two of her children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 12 years. Her mixed farm produces eggs and milk which she sells to the local market. Farming is her main source of income.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000KES to expand her poultry farm. The proceeds from this loan will go a long way in the education of her children and grandchildren. She says that epidermic diseases are rampant in the area and this has been her biggest challenge.

She is grateful to Juhudi for supporting her to undertake her project to another level.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting products

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara K., 31, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Unfortunately, Dinara is a widow. She has two sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet. Dinara works as a nurse; her monthly salary is 3000 soms. Four years ago with the initial investment of 30000 soms, she started to breed livestock animals. In order to make additional money to cover family expenses, she resells livestock after fattening at the higher price. In this way, she earns additional 5000 soms. With money received from the loan, Dinara wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future, she wants to provide her children good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, 58, is a dairy farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. He sells his milk to a local cooling plant. He also earns income from his large-scale farming of maize.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. He says that his major challenge has been the poor road network. He hopes however to purchase a pick-up in the future to assist him in transporting his products to the market.

Jackson is a married father of three children who are now between the ages of 16 and 24. Two of the children are currently attending school. He comments that Juhudi's terms and conditions are convenient and good.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lena's Group

texts.en:
Lena A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Lena, 43, is married to a constructor. Together they bring up two daughters; both of them are at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Lena and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, they earn 2000 soms per month. The family applied for the loan because they need money to purchase three more livestock animals for breeding. In the future. Lena wants to improve the family’s living conditions and provide her children good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135P.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has a mixed farm in Kisii town western Kenya that produces maize, beans and bananas. He has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years now. He is also employed as a casual laborer in the same region.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 25,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will improve his milk production and his family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to build rental houses in future and open a retail shop. He also plans to start poultry farming in future.

Joel is 37 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jenes

texts.en:
Jenes M., 60, is a widowed mother of eight children who are all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya where she has been farming for more than 40 years. She employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces tea, potatoes, bananas and milk which she sells locally. She solely depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in the education of her children and grandchildren. Her major challenges have been poor weather conditions, and pests and diseases which affect her production. She plans to acquire two more dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en:
Chynar B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. She is 34 and married to a constructor. Together they bring up a son, 7, who studies at school. In order to earn money to cover family expenses with the initial investment of 15000 soms Chynar started to sell apples a year ago. In this way, she earns 6000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and make house repairs. Chynar hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase one ton of apples in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase apples for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 13 years. Her main products are maize, potatoes, sorghum, tea and beans which are all sold locally. Grace is 33 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of 18 months and 12 years old.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go toward the education of her children. She plans to own a posho mill in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 65 years old and married with two children, ages 28 and 34. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. His farm produces tea, sugarcane, vegetables and maize which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income realized from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. In future, he aspires to start a retail cereals store at his local market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. He has a farm in Kisii town, western Kenya that produces maize, beans, bananas, tea and milk, which are all sold locally. He depends on the income from his farm to provide for the needs of his family.

Peter is 69 years old, and married, with 12 children between the ages of 18 and 28. Two of his children are currently attending school.

He has requested this 45,000KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Peter says this will ensure that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His biggest challenge has been the high cost of transportation due to poor road networks in the area. He would like to acquire more dairy cows in future and purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting his products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Huyagbaatar

texts.en: Huyagbaatar T. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in the city of Harhorin in  Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son attends a secondary school in town. Huyagbaatar, with his wife operates a dairy product trading business. He started his dairy product selling business in 2008 at the “Manlai” local market. He goes to the countryside in his car to buy large amounts of dairy products. He then  sell the products in his sisters store. Huyagbaatar is planning to buy a new car for his business. He is a very hardworking person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a  new car

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya that produces maize, millet, tea, sugarcane and milk which are sold locally. She has been in the farming business for the last forty years. She is 63 years old and married with 9 children who are between the ages of 17 and 43. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000KES to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood. Her biggest challenge has been a lack of finance to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet  the basic needs of his family. He is 56 years old and married with 6 children who are between the ages of 5 and 37. His youngest child is currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. His major challenge is the lack of an organized market for his products. He plans to start poultry farming in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zaphaniah

texts.en:
Zaphaniah is sixty years old and married with thirteen children who are all adults. He is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya where he has been farming for over ten years. He sells his milk, bananas and maize to the local market.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. He says that his milk production will improve and his family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His biggest challenge has been the poor weather conditions and diseases which affect his production. In future, he would like to start pig farming.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 27-year-old Yun S.’s every day duty at the garment industry. Yun S. has been engaged in her job since 2005 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chef who works at various places around the province of Kompong Cham. The couple help each other to earn money to feed their two children. Both of the children are attending school. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Yun S. has decided to seek a loan through Kiva for capital to buy more rice to stock and sell. Some of rice she will used to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice to stock and sell.

loans.name: Tsermaa

texts.en:
Tsermaa T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in her own house with a fence in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her younger son is a university student and her older son operates a taxi service business. Her husband is a private businessman. 

Tsermaa and her husband started their old book selling business in 2002 after moving from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar.  She rented a space outside the  Achlal department store for 100000 MNT a month and sells all kinds of a rare books, schoolbooks, dictionaries and textbooks of foreign languages. 

Tsermaa is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to buy a greater variety of books for her book selling business.

loans.use: To buy more books

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson O. is 68 years old and married with eight children who are all adults. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 40 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces maize, beans, tea, milk and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. Farming is his only source of income.

He has requested  a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will be invested into the family's other businesses. He would like to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring five more dairy cows and investing more in horticultural crops.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S. is  from  Banteay Meanchey province and is married to Kuy Mang, 28, an ice cream seller. They have one child.  Keo S. is a tailor and she has been running her sewing business since 2000. Keo S. provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers admire the good service she provides. 

Currently, Keo S.’s husband uses his old motorbike (Tok Tok) to pick up his ice cream for selling. Now, her husband wants to decorate his old motorbike, but he lacks money to do it. Keo S. will use her loan to help her husband to decorate the old motorcycle.

loans.use: To decorate the motorcycle used for selling ice cream

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses N. is 47 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 1 and 22. Four of the children attend school.

Moses is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and employs one farm hand. He sells his maize, beans, tomatoes, coffee, tea, milk and bananas to the local market. He also works as a casual laborer with a local cooperative society. He faces the challenge of diseases that affect his production.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He would like to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun N. is a 68-year-old woman who lives with her daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house with a fence. Her daughter works as a glass washer for the APU Company, while her son-in-law is a driver at the local police department. Her grandchildren both are in kindergarten. 

Oyun operates a grocery trading business in the city. She started her business in 1998 in a small shop and has since built a stable operation. For the future, she plans to expand her business and open her own grocery store. Oyun is requesting  a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to expand her product line for her small food shop.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M., 45, is married and the father of four children who are between the ages of 2 and 24. He is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His mixed farm produces bananas, tea, coffee, maize and milk, which are all sold locally. His primary challenges are the poor road network and poor prices for farm produce.

He has requested a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 29-year-old married man living in Tayouneh with his wife and three children. Diab has owned a laundry since 2007,  and he has 12 years of experience. 

Diab is a hard worker. His family is his main concern, and he struggles for their happiness and security. 

Diab is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy new machines for his business. Diab would like to expand his business and improve it to a more updated style. Most of his clients are single, students and employees. His prices are affordable.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 48 years old and married. She lives in Cordova, Lapu-Lapu city.  She supports her family through her abaca fiber (also known as Manila hemp) business.

Gloria has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her abaca fiber business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. 

Gloria is borrowing PHP 13000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 	

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon M. is 51 years old and married with 10 children who are now between the ages of 2 and 30. Six of the children are currently attending school.

Zablon has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces milk, sugarcane, tea, coffee and maize. He has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells his products to the local market.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children. He would like to acquire four dairy cows in the next five years and open a butcher shop.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and the only provider for his family and parents who live with him.

Mohamad decided to open his own business so he opened a barber shop in 2004. He is well known in his local community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,700 loan to renovate his shop, buy a small generator and install an aluminum closet. He is aiming to increase his revenues and expand his business.

loans.use: To renovate his shop, buy a small generator and install an aluminum closet

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob M. is 29 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 4 months and 6. He has been practicing mixed farming for five years in Kisii town, western Kenya. He sells his products to the local market. His biggest challenges have been low market prices for his products and poor weather conditions, which affect his production.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He hopes to expand his farming in the future and buy a vehicle to help in the transportation of his farm products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza F. is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business making siopao (steamed buns) and hamburgers. Her husband Melvin, who is 32 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 10 and 14 years old. Annaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 years because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for her siopao and hamburger making so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Annaliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operation of her siopao and hamburger making business

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 33-year-old married man and father of two kids.  Jalal has worked in transportation since 2002.  He takes tourists on journeys all over Lebanon, sometimes crossing borders to other nearby countries.  He also transports student to and from school.

Jalal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to register a new van.  He hopes to open a tourist company in the future as he believes he’s on the track to achieve this right now.

loans.use: To register a new van

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa A. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Uvd province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence.

Davaa operates a firewood and coal selling business, with the help of his wife, in their town. He has been engaged in this business for the past 2 years and has gained much experience. He purchases one truck of coal and firewood and packages them into bags to sell at the local market as a retailer. Their monthly business profit reaches between 100,000 and 120,000 MNT.

Davaa is a modest man. For the future, he says, "All I want is to provide higher education for my children and see them live a decent life." He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase 2.5 tons of coal and half a truckload of wood at wholesale prices for his business.

loans.use: To purchase 2.5 tons of coal and half a truckload of wood

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared has been in the farming business for five years now. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces milk, maize, beans, bananas and tea which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet his family's basic needs. 

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will be invested in the family's other businesses. He would like to venture into poultry and pig farming in the future. His challenges include lack of enough capital for expansion and a poor transport network.

Jared is 27 years old and married with 2 children ages 5 and 7. Both children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dulambayar

texts.en:
Dulambayar T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her three children all attend a local school.

Dulambayar and her husband operate family businesses which include vegetable growing and trading, consumer goods trading and grocery products trading. She plants her vegetables in her own 2 hectares of field during summer months and preserves those vegetables in her own cellar in order to sell as a retailer during spring months.

She started her vegetable growing and selling business in 1994 along with the other business of consumer goods trading. After years of successful operation, she was able to expand her business by operating a grocery trading business in 2005 to supplement her earnings.

Over the many years, she has gained much experience in her trade and her earnings have enabled her to improve her family's standard of living greatly. Dulambayar is a modest and hardworking person. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount fruit and food products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of fruit and food products

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny C. is a 49-year old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog-raising and a general store. She lives in Tagdalungon, Brgy. Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan where she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog-raising and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600.

Leny is requesting her 14th loan for PHP 18,500 to purchase piglets and feeds.
