Her previous loan of PHP 16,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leny aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Nhcem

texts.en:
Nhcem S. has been in the farming business for years, planting various crops to earn a living and typically generating an income of $2.5 per day. His wife earns a living selling a few products in her village. This couple has been married for many years and has four children, one married and three single, all employed in various jobs.

Nhcem’s children share their salary to support the daily expenses of the whole family, but they face difficulties travelling to work, having to either walk or take taxis. To solve this obstacle, Nhcem is requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy a used motorbike for his children to commute to their work locations.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for his children to commute to their work locations.

loans.name: Hatantuul

texts.en:
Hatantuul B. is 24 years old and lives with her father and sister the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her father is retired and both her sister and father stay at home. 

Hatantuul completed her bachelor's degree in 2007 and currently operates a hair salon in a rented space at the local trade center. She started her hair dressing business in 2010 after graduating from a vocational training course as a hairdresser. 

For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business as a stable operation. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a chair and more hair cutting tools and equipment for her hair salon.

loans.use: To purchase a chair and more hair cutting tools

loans.name: Nyabuto

texts.en:
Nyabuto has been farming for fifteen years in Kisii town in western Kenya. He employs four casual laborers. His farm produces maize, milk, tea and beans which are all sold locally. He also runs a retail shop in the same area.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. He also plans to venture into poultry farming in the next five years. 

Nyabuto is 42 years old. He is married and has been blessed with five school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dembe Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
45-year-old K. Medi has been in the taxi transport business for the past fifteen years, operating from the Jinja taxi park. His daily round involves transporting commuters in and around the metropolis and suburbs of Jinja. What has endeared him to most passengers in his taxi are his good human relationship skills. He comes across as highly spirited, courteous and down to earth, in spite of the stressful nature of his Job. 

Medi, who is happily married with four kids, says he began this business after he finished school. This job, unlike others, did not call for much experience. He had already gone through the mill of driving in his high school days. 

He is a family oriented man, and on that basis he plans for his family's welfare on a continual basis. He says that in the future he is planning to provide a whole new lease on life in terms of his family's welfare. He talks enthusiastically about seeing his kids through school, given the fact that he himself did not get a good chance to pursue his education further. 

Weekly this business generates about $22, and with this loan he says he is going to purchase better car tyres. Medi belongs to Dembe Women's group-Jinja. The irony with this group is that it is referred to as women's group but it actually has no women in it.

loans.use: The purchase of better car tyres

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren U. is 50 years old and lives with her two sons in a house in Bayanhoshuu in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older son attends university while her younger son works as a private businessman.

She currently operates a retail clothing business to support her family. She sells a variety of clothing items from a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest and main market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2000 and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. 

In the future, Dolgorsuren hopes to expand her business further and help her two sons to live their own. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for her retail clothing business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old married man, living in Tayouneh with his wife and one child. Hasan has worked on his own as a barber since 2004, and has a totA. of thirteen years of experience in this field. Most of his clients are friends, relatives and neighbors. They like his work and are relaxed being his clients. 

Hasan is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to add decorations to his shop, buy necessary tools for his business and to increase his inventory of products, such as gel and creams. Hasan is planning to open a big beauty therapy center, which he claims will include everything a man needs to cheer up.

loans.use: To add decorations to his shop

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean V. is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. Kean V. is married to Srey Sokheng, age 56. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to six children. Two of the children are married and four are single. Two of them are sewing workers in the garment factory and have a regular salary. 

Currently, Kean V.’s home is not comfortable for living because most of it is in need of repair. Kean V. says that she and her family have been living in this house for a long time, and she has not yet repaired it, even one time. Because her savings account is not sufficient to have it repaired, Kean V. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to add to her personal savings to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Kibari

texts.en:
Kibari has been practicing mixed farming for forty years in Kisii town in western Kenya. His main products are maize, beans, potatoes, sugarcane and tea, which are sold locally. Farming is his only source of income. 

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His major challenges have been the lack of enough capital for expansion and a poor road network. He would like to open an agrovet shop in the future (providing animal health services and farm supplies).

Kibari is 62 years old and married with fifteen children who are between the ages of 13 and 30. Two of the children are currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
36-year-old Betty N.'s entrepreneurial nature is what has put momentum into the success of her retail business over the course of the last five years in Wakitaka-Jinja. The financial and moral support of her husband, who actually began the shop, has been of paramount importance, too. 

In her shop, she sells a variety of retail commodities, but priority is given to goods which are in high favor with many rank-and-file people around her neighborhood. These goods include sugar, soap, sodas, rice, beans, etc. She says the business generates about $378 a month. 

Before all this came to fruition, Betty was a housewife. She and her husband are happily married and have four kids who all go to school.  Betty is requesting this loan to purchase more retail commodities like salt, washing and bathing soap, plastics, etc. to resell. She envisions improved sales revenue prospects in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities such as salt, washing and bathing soap, plastics, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children.

In 2006, Ali opened his own food market because the competition in his local area is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting $1,800 to install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and buy two refrigerators. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and buy two refrigerators

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh D. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons attend a local school. Her husband operates a block producing business during spring and summer months and she helps him with the business to prepare monthly and yearly balance sheets and other bookkeeping. 

Her husband's business is seasonal, so they decided to run a more sustainable business, which is the sales of solar and wind powered antenna. She started this business in March, 2010. They sell solar and wind antennas to the herders and install those antennas around the countryside. In addition, her husband and her father-in-law are both famous race horse trainers. 

In the future, they plan to provide a repair services to their customers, so her husband needs to attend a training course. Gansuh is a very modest and hardworking person. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more antennas.

loans.use: To purchase more antennas

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Benson is a farmer in Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for eight years. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. His main products are tea, sugarcane, milk and maize, which he sells to the local market. He is married and has been blessed with three children, one of whom attends school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his family's livelihood will improve with the extra income that will be earned from this loan. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the next five years by purchasing five high-yielding dairy cows. He faces the challenge of diseases which affect his production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar is 24 years old, single, and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He lives with his mom and niece in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent. His mother is retired. Tsogtbayar is a professional producer and used to work for national broadcasting television as a producer for six years. He is currently employed with “Bolovsrol” television, as a producer as well. Tsogtbayar is an artistic and very hardworking person, and this is the only income for his family. He is planning to make movies and do advertising. Therefore, he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new professional video camera.

loans.use: To purchase a new professional video camera

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah is forty-eight years old and married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 23 years old.  Five of his children currently attend school. He has been farming for twelve years in Kisii, western Kenya.  His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, sugarcane, and coffee, which are sold locally.  His major business challenges have been low market prices for farm produce and pests and diseases that affect his production.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the future and also to own a posho mill.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a house surrounded by a fence. His oldest daughter attends secondary school and his wife stays at home to care for their children.  Jargalsaihan supports his entire family by operating an iron crafting business in his town.  He produces a variety of steel/metal items according to his customers’ specification.  Before starting his iron craft business, Jargalsaihan operated a traditional Mongolian shoe-making business in his home starting in 2000. He started his metal business in 2005 and it has grown into a stable operation over the years.  He has expanded his business by hiring two to three workers.  He produces a variety of metal goods in his rented work place.  After years of hard work, he has gained a wide customer base. He needs own car for delivery iron. Because Jargalsaihan rented by car for delivery iron materials, which is a using to make metal goods, but it is expensive. In the future, he plans to enlarge his house and its surrounding fence so he can build a work space within his compound. Jargalsaihan is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a car for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Alawi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old and lives with five family members. 

In 2006, Alawi opened a mobile phones shop in his local area where competition is minimal. He has a good reputation and he is well known.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and renovate the store. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase his revenues.

loans.use: Install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and renovate the store

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is 32 years old and married.  She has 6 children who all attend school.  Wilter has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in Kisii, western Kenya.  Her farm produces tea, sugarcane, maize, and vegetables that she sells locally.  Her major challenges have been pests and diseases and low market prices for her products.

She requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income generated from this loan will help her pay the school fees for her children.  She plans to build a greenhouse in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Njenvede Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: K. Sirag is 45 years old and a happily married father of six children.  Over the last decade, he has achieved many of his goals through hard work in his retail trade business in Jinja.   He began his retail trade business with capital earned from his earlier farming business.  He also has a side grocery business.  His retail business generates 80,000 weekly.  Because of his strong work ethic, he has many old and new customers every day, resulting in the growth of his niche and profit base.  He wants to be able to handle the operational cost of the business and meet customer demands, which sometimes inundate him.  There are days and seasons when he cannot meet the high customer demand because of too few commodities.  In the event that this happen in the future, he does not want to be caught off-guard.  The acquisition of this loan will help a great deal by enabling him to restock.  With this loan, K. will purchase more retail goods such as bags of sugar, salt, rice, cooking oil, and other items for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail goods such as sugar, salt, for resell

loans.name: Reda

texts.en: Reda is a 31 year-old married man who has worked as a van driver since 2001.  Reda transports students to and from school.  Reda started this business because he had problems finding a job with a good income.  He is improving his business and himself.  Reda is willing to expand his business through the addition of more vans.  He requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to conduct the necessary maintenance on his van.  His clients recommend him to their friends because of his honesty and loyalty.

loans.use: To make the necessary maintenance to his van

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new consignment of drugs

loans.name: Miry

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.

In 2006, Miry decided to open his own business to increase his family's income. Therefore he opened a restaurant. He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install an external ceiling on the entrance of the restaurant and renovate it. He is aiming to extend his business and improve his work.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling on the entrance of the restaurant and renovate it

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dozens more slippers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more beans, seasoning, rice, oil, pepper, tomato etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more rock

loans.name: Balinaki Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Betty N. is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She has run her pub in Likolo, Jinja for one year. She began with savings from her teaching job and food sales business. A variety of alcoholic beverages are offered for sale at her pub. Most of her clients are low and middle income earners around Likolo. Given the low remuneration that she receives as a teacher, this business with its 50,000 UGX weekly profits provides additional income to Betty to help her improve her circumstances and those of her family as well.. With proceeds from this loan, Betty says she is going to revamp her business with purchases of more crates of alcoholic beverages to sell at her pub. Betty belongs to Balinaki Development Group-Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase of more crates of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, oil, etc. for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more building materials for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of ‘palm wine’ for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy blouses, jeans skirts, and underclothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, meat, fish, pepper, salt, and oinions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dozens of lappa (traditional dresses) to sell to her customers

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha sells a large variety of items in her boutique. She is 44 years old, married to a farmer and has owned her boutique for the last three years. She will use her loan to buy more items to sell, including books, lotions, biscuits, salt, sugar, rice, soaps and cooking oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay her children's school fees, reinvest in her business and buy food for her family. Her goal in the future is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell, such as salt, sugar, rice, lotions and stationery.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works with her husband to produce a juice that is made out of sorghum. She is 34 years old and has four children who range in age from four to 13. In the picture you can see the containers that she uses to prepare her juice. Rose has been in this business for five years.  

She has applied for a loan to buy more sorghum to turn into juice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save money, provide food for her family and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make into a juice

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en:
Blandine is 36 years old, married and has four children between three and 16 years old. Currently, three of her children attend school, except the youngest. Blandine produces local beer and juice from sorghum, which she has done for a period of six years. In the picture, Blandine is at her place of work with materials used to prepare local juices and beers. Her husband works as an artisan in their village. 

Blandine will use the loan to buy more sorghum. With the new profits from her expanded business, Blandine plans to purchase more sorghum, food for the family, and pay the school fees for her children. She dreams of having a big stock of sorghum in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to produce more local beers and juice to sell

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en: Thacienne is 35 years old, married and has two children. Currently, her children both attend school. Thacienne sells a variety of household goods in her boutique, which she has been operating for six years. Her husband is a businessperson. Thacienne will use the loan to purchase more items for her boutique. With the new profits from her expanded boutique, Thacienne plans to build a business premises. She would like to have a successful and wealthy business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 41-year-old married man and father of two kids. He has been the owner of a perfume and cosmetics sales shop since 2001. Mouhamad's work is special since he makes his own perfumes upon request. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his products and introduce new ones to his clients. Mouhamad’s clients are his neighbors, friends and relatives. Most of them are teenagers. He works hard for his children’s education and seeks to provide them with the best education. Mouhamad hopes to expand his business and start wholesale trade in the future

loans.use: To increase his products

loans.name: Ghokale Group-Jinja

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Monic W. belongs to Ghokale group-Jinja. She has been overseeing her cattle and goat sales businesses in Ivunamba for 20 years. The happily married mother of 10 says she has been able to live within the ways and means of this business throughout this time. Yet, as with any other business, she has had to bear a lot of challenges, mostly the scarcity of clients during particular seasons. Monic also runs a modest grocery business that she says brings her supplementary profits. With this loan, Monic says she is going to buy more animals, principally cattle, that she says she will resell later.

loans.use: The purchase of more cattle for resale

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. Two of his family members live with him.

In 2007, Jaafar opened his own car repair shop after having good experience in this field. He used to work with his dad in the same business. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a big generator. He is planning to develop his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Nsiimya Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Forty-year-old Martin N. has for the last five years been making common cause with Nsiimya Development group-Jinja. Martin traces his roots in his current business to agriculture. It is from his small agricultural business that he got money to start up his vegetable stall in Kakira market. Before all that, he was involved in a second hand clothes sales business. Around Kakira, most people associate Martin with diligence and determination. The happily married father of five says weekly this business generates him 80,000 shillings. Martin says that with this loan he is going to rejuvenate his business operations. In essence, that means buying more vegetables to resell at his stall.

loans.use: The purchase of more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more petroleum products

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo es casado, tiene un bebe; es una pareja muy joven y viven en casa de los padres de Abelardo durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es maestro albañil; trabaja en obras de construcción  de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposa le ayuda realizando trabajos de ayudante de albañilería en las mismas obras que su esposo. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para sanear los papeles de un terreno el cual ellos adquirieron, donde planean construir su casa  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Abelardo is married and has a baby.  He and his wife are a very young couple and they have been living in Abelardo's parents' house for a long time, in Lloteja district, in the city of La Paz.

Abelardo is a master builder.  He does construction work in the southern area of the city of La Paz .  His wife helps him, carrying out work as an assistant builder on the same projects as her husband.  This is how they make income for their household.

Abelardo will use his loan to clear up the title on a plot of land that they have acquired, where they plan to build their house.  This will enable them to improve their quality of life.,

This is Abelardo's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: To cover the cost of putting in order the transfer papers for a plot of land

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de San Sebastián. El distrito de San Sebastián se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 15 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca. 

Luciano se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público en su taxi. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Luciano y su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, ellos tienen corrales en su domicilio donde se encuentra los animales seleccionados según el tamaño y la raza. Ellos venden sus animales a cocineros de restaurantes, vecinos, amigos y clientes recurrentes. Los clientes preparan ricos platos de comida como por ejemplo caldo de gallina, estofado de gallina, etc.  Con su próximo préstamo, Luciano que espera recibir S/.1800 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, gallinas de doble pechuga. 

Luciano pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Luciano lives with his wife and four children in San Sebastián district.  San Sebastián district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department, 15 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to the time of the Incas.  Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Luciano provides public transport services in his taxi.  He has been providing transport services for several years and his business is doing ok.

Luciano and his wife also have a small business raising and selling young animals such as chickens.  They have pens at home where they keep their animals, selected according to their size and breed.  They sell their animals to restaurant chefs, neighbors, friends and regular customers.  Their customers prepare delicious dishes such as, for example, chicken soup, chicken stew, etc.

With his loan, Luciano hopes to receive 1,800 Peruvian soles.  He would like to use this money to increase his business capital and to buy merchandise such as, for example, 'double-breasted chickens'.

Luciano belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank.  The bank is in its second year and it is well run by a board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, 'double-breasted chickens'

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more phone cards

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene 23 años, y después de titularse espera trabajar,  es estudiante de 3º año de la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas en la UDABOL; el crédito requiere para pago de pensiones de un curso de especialización en sistemas. Trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de las salas del cine Mega Center, que esta ubicado en la zona de Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Álvaro is single and doesn't have any children.  He has lived for a long time in his parents' home, in Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is 23 years old and, after he leaves university, he hopes to work.

Álvaro is in his third year of a systems engineering degree at UDABOL.  He requires this loan to pay his tuition for a specialization course.  He works as a maintenance worker in the Mega Center cinema complex which is located in Irpavi neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  This is how he makes income for his household.

This is Álvaro's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: To pay for a specialization course

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignments of medicine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new DVD and VCD discs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Tto buy more rock

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
Casimiro vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas. La ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
 
Casimiro se dedica a la fabricación de artículos confeccionados de materiales textiles como por ejemplo ropa de vestir, ternos, etc. Hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va regular. Casimiro que espera recibir S/.500 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, botones, hilos y muchas cosas más.

Casimiro pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Casimiro lives with his wife and three children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department, 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to Inca times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Casimiro makes items from textiles such as, for example, clothes, suits, etc.  He has been in this business for several years and it is going ok.  Casimiro hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles.  He will use this money to increase his business capital and buy materials such as, for example, fabric, buttons, threads and many other items.

Casimiro is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials such as, for example, fabric, buttons, threads and many other items

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 53 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 2 hijos de los 4 que tiene. Su esposo es militar por lo que vive en otra provincia, a quien le visita con mucha frecuencia. Doña Hilda hace muchos años se dedica, a la confección de prenda militares. En todo este tiempo, su esposo que es militar; ha sido su gran apoyo, ya que por medio de él sus compañeros de trabajo le hacen pedidos a Hilda para que le confeccione dichas prendas, como: boinas, escarpines, lencerías y demás indumentarias al por mayor, para los militares. Eso la hace muy feliz a Hilda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que lo realiza en la comodidad de su casa, y además, le es muy rentable. Pero cuando no tiene mucho trabajo, viaja al interior del país para visitar a su esposo, y a su hijo que también es militar, y se encuentra en otra provincia. En adelante, piensa retomar su empresa de confecciones; que lo dejó por motivos de salud. Es su 2do crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas en las fechas señaladas en el cronograma, de esa manera accede a posteriores créditos en adelante. Con el crédito, podrá realizar un viaje a la frontera del ecuador, donde  se halla su hijo, a quien extraña mucho, ya que hace un año se fue a servir al país.
texts.en:
Hilda is 53 years old.  She lives in her own home with two of her four children.  Her husband is in the military and lives in another province.  She visits him very frequently.

For many years, Hilda's business has been making clothes for the military.  Her husband, who is a soldier, has been a great support during all this time.  since, through him, his work colleagues make orders with Hilda for her to make clothes for them wholesale such as: berets, socks, underwear and other clothes.  This makes Hilda very happy.  What she most likes about her work is that she can do it in the comfort of her own home and it is also very profitable.  When she doesn't have a lot of work, Hilda travels to the country's interior to visit her husband and also to visit her son who is also a soldier and in another province.  In the future, she is planning to re-start her dressmaking business that she stopped because of her health.

This is Hilda's second loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  In this way, she will be able to access further loans in the future.  Hilda will use her loan to make a journey to the Ecuadoran border where her son is stationed.  She misses him a lot because he went off to serve his country a year ago.

loans.use: To travel to Ecuador to visit her son who is a soldier

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 25 años y vive en el distrito de San Sebastián. El distrito de San Sebastián se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 15 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca. 

Alejandro se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público en un taxi alquilado. Alejandro alquila un taxi por 12 horas a un precio de 25 nuevos soles. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Con su próximo préstamo, Alejandro que espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles. Este dinero es para uso personal. 

Alejandro pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 25 years old and lives in the district of San Sebastián. The San Sebastián district is located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco, 15 minutes from the main square [Plaza de Armas] in Cusco, the archaeological capital of South America. Cusco is an enchanting city which goes back to the time of the Incas; the city of Cusco has been constructed on the foundation of the ancient Inca settlement. 

Alejandro's work is providing public transportation services in a rented taxi. He rents a taxi for 12 hours at a cost of 25 Peruvian new soles. He has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for several years, and it has gone moderately well for him. With his next loan, Alejandro hopes to receive 1000 new soles. These funds will be for personal use.  

Alejandro belongs to the "New Hope" communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The communal bank is in its second year of operation, and it is well managed by its board of directors.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen Luz; La socia tiene 51 años D. edad, es viuda  y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a prestar el servicio D. movilidad, la socia tiene una combi y la autorización D. transporte para llevar niños D. la escuela a la casa y viceversa, la socia también se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa para adultos, ella trae cada cierto tiempo en vacaciones escolares ropa D. la ciudad D. Lima D. las fábricas al por mayor y las venD. a sus amistades y amigos en general, la socia ahora requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa , ella estará pronta a viajar a la ciudad D. Lima y traer ropa para adultos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Eternal Father" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Carmen Luz, and she is 51 years old. She is a widow and has 2 children. Her work is providing transportation services. She has a van and has authorization to transport children to school and back home. She also works buying and selling clothing for adults. On certain occasions, during school vacations, she goes to the city of Lima and buys clothes on a wholesale basis, which she sells to her friends and acquaintances. She currently requires a loan to invest in buying clothing. She will soon be able to travel to the city of Lima and bring back clothing for adults. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying clothing. 

The borrower is happy with the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in clothing to sell

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 43 años, está casada con Mauro, de 46 años de edad. Ambos tiene 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Walter, de 22 y Carlos de 15 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Hace 30 años que se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja, lo que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma; pero ahora su dedicación y esfuerzo se multiplicaron ya que su esposo, y fiel compañero, está trabajando en una empresa de construcción de una hidroeléctrica, dejándola sola en el cuidado de sus cultivos, pero Rayda, tiene pensando contratar peones, para que le ayuden a sembrar papa para está temporada, y de esa manera poder dedicarle más tiempo al cuidado de sus animales; entre cerdos, toros, burros y corderos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en ser puntual con los pagos y las reuniones que se realiza en su banco comunal, donde está segura, saldrá adelante. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en su próxima cosecha.
texts.en: Rayda, age 43, is married to Mauro, who is 46 years old. Together they have had 4 children, but only 2 are still living: Walter, age 22, and Carlos, age 15. As a family they live in their own house, located in the settlement of Cumutay. For the past 30 years, Rayda has worked growing potatoes and peas, which she sells after each harvest at the wholesale market in Tarma. However, her dedication and effort are now multiplied, because her husband and loyal companion is working for a company that is building a hydroelectric facility, leaving her alone to cultivate their crops. Rayda is thinking about hiring some laborers to help her plant the potatoes for this season, allowing her to dedicate more time to the care of her animals, which include pigs, bulls, burros and sheep. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments and at the meetings held by her communal bank. She is certain that the group will help her get ahead. When she obtains the loan she is requesting, she will invest it in buying several sacks of pea seeds, which she will plant for the next harvest.

loans.use: Buying several sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Campanitass Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama CAMPANITAS, Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Martin Texmelucan, puebla en México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 
Leticia M., tiene 28 (años), estudió hasta el 1er. Semestre de bachiller, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos: 2 hombres y 1 mujer.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtir algunos pedidos. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con mucho entusiasmo y muy feliz. Quiere este crédito para que sigan creciendo sus pedidos. También espera lograr establecer su negocio y obtener mucho más ganancias. Observación: Todas las clientas salen en la foto, la señora Refugio P. es la que no se ve bien, sólo se alcanza a ver parte de su cara porque quedo mal acomodada a la hora de tomarse la foto.
texts.en:
This group is called CAMPANITAS (Little Bells).  It is located in the town of San Martin Texmelucan, Puebla, in Mexico.  The group has 10 members.

Leticia M. is 28 years old.  She studied up to the first semester of high school.  She is a salesworman and has 3 children: 2 sons and 1 daughter.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She started her business three years ago and is requesting this loan so that she can fill some orders.  As she requests this loan, Leticia is feeling very enthusiastic and very happy.  She would like this loan so that her orders can continue to grow.  She also hopes to be able to establish her business and obtain a lot more profits.

Observation: all the group's members appear in this photo.  Refugio P. is the lady who can't be seen very well.  You can only see part of her face because she was poorly positioned when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To fill some orders

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca. 

Silverio trabaja como administrador de una empresa privada. Con su próximo préstamo, Silverio que espera recibir S/.500 nuevos soles. Este dinero es para uso personal y no especifica con detalle para que exactamente. 

Silverio pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Silverio lives with his wife and two children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  It is called 'The Flower District' and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas in the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is a delightful city that dates back to Incan times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Silverio works as an administrator in a private company.  He hopes to receive a loan for 500 Peruvian soles.  This money is for personal use and he does not specify in detail what exactly it is for.

Silverio belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: For personal use

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Martha; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al comercio minorista de venta de licores a domicilio, la socia tiene un pequeño deposito en casa en el cual acopia vinos, pisco, licores,entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de licores y vinos, ella tiene unos proveedores y ellos le traen desde la frontera una variedad de bebidas exóticas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de licores y vinos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the "PADRE ETERNO" (Eternal Father) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Martha is 51 years old, married and has 4 children.  Her business is making home delivery liquor sales.  She has a small storage area in her home where she stores wine, 'pisco' (a Peruvian brandy-like drink), liquor and other drinks. 

Martha is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying liquor and wine.  She has suppliers who bring her a variety of exotic drinks from the border.  Martha is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying liquor and wine

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 55 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Sara, y sus 3 pequeños hijos, a los cuales cuida, educa y cría, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El pilar de su vida, es la agricultura, y aunque a veces tiene altibajos y complicaciones, él sigue adelante. Ya tiene 35 años dedicándose a esto, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arvejas, olluco y oca, los cuales cuida y fertiliza todos los fines de semana, ya que está trabajando en una empresa de construcción, cuyo proyecto es la creación en una hidroeléctrica en la zona. Pero a pesar del poco tiempo que dispone Antonio, esperar tener una buena calidad de sus productos en está nueva cosecha, que le constará mucho esfuerzo, ya que necesitan mayor cuidado, por épocas de lluvia. Para más adelante desea obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, e incrementar su producción. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y está segura que seguirá trabajando de manera activa y responsable por el desarrollo de su banco comunal. De obtener el crédito solicitado, invertirá en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 55 years old.  He lives with his wife Sara and their three young children who he looks after, educates and raises in his own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

The pillar of Antonio's life is farming and although he sometimes has his ups and downs and complications he continues to get ahead in life.  He has been a farmer for 35 years.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, 'olluco' and 'oca' (these last two being native tubers).  He looks after his crops and fertilizes them every weekend since he also works for a construction company which is building a hydroelectric power station in the area.

In spite of the fact that Antonio doesn't have much time, he hopes to produce good quality crops in his next harvest.  This will require a lot of hard work since they need more looking after during rainy periods.  He would like, in the future, to obtain more farming land and to increase his production.

This is Antonio's sixth loan with MFP and he is certain that he will continue working actively and responsibly with his community bank.  He will invest his loan in buying several sacks of organic manure which he will spread on his different crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.

Carlos se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público en su propio taxi. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Con su próximo préstamo, Carlos que espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea utilizar para uso personal y desea comprar artefactos o electrodomésticos. 

Carlos pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province and department.  It is known as the "District of Flowers" and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is a delightful city that dates back to Incan times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Carlos provides public transport services in his own taxi.  He has been providing transport services for several years and his business is going ok.  He hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which he would like to use for personal purchases.  He would like to buy electrical appliances.

Carlos is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: For personal use.  To buy some electrical appliances

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 29 años, está casada con Percy, de 30 años de edad. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Ronaldo, de 8 y Jair, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Está exitosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y habas, hace ya 19 años. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder, salir al campo desde las primeras horas del día a cuidar de sus cultivos, los cuales ahora está creciendo sin mayores inconvenientes; pues augura que está próxima cosecha obtendrá buenas ganancias en sus ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde lleva a vender su producción. Ahora ella está trabajando duro para poder cosechar su cultivo de papa, y después orientar sus ganancias hacia los estudios de sus hijos. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compañía de los integrantes de su banco comunal, que son personas trabajadoras. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arveja, para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Raquel, age 29, is married to Percy, who is 30 years old. Together they have 2 children: Ronaldo, age 8, and Jair, age 2. As a family, they live in a rented house, located in the community of Cumutay. Raquel is a successful woman who has worked growing potatoes, peas and beans for the past 19 years. What she likes most is going out into the fields early in the morning to care for her crops, which are now growing without significant problems. This means that after the coming harvest, she will likely obtain good profits from her sales at the wholesale market in Tarma, where she takes her produce to sell. She is now working hard so that she can harvest her potato crops, and she will later use her earnings for her children's education. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she hopes to get ahead in the company of the members of her communal bank, who are hard-working people. When she obtains the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying 2 sacks of pea seeds for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: Buying 2 sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purcase more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Luisa Elena P. E. tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, reside en Colonia El Eden en la ciudad de Juticalpa y es integrante del Grupo Solidario Genesis. Luisa se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de las marcas Avon, Flush y Arabela. Ella aprendio este negocio de sus hermana. Su forma de vender es de casa en casa enseñando los catalagos de productos. Trabaja desde las 2:00 pm hasta las 5:00 pm y lo hace desde hace 4 años. Con el prestamo comprara mas cosmeticos como: listick, sombras, esmalte para uñas, lapiz de labios y ojos, polvos para la cara, shampos, etc. Y eso le ayudara a mantener un mayor inventario y podra ofrecerles a sus clientes mas variedad. 

Luisa tiene un problema de salud en sus ojos y su enfermedad se llama Cataratas. Su sueño es poder tener la capacidad economica para tratarse medicamente su problema de la vista y que su negocio le siga permitiendo sostenerse. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por tres ciclos y es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Luisa Elena P. E. is 34 years old. She is single with no children, and she lives in the El Eden neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa. She is a member of the Genesis Solidarity Group. Luisa works selling cosmetics from the Avon, Flush and Arabela brands. She learned this business from her sister. Her method of selling is from house to house, explaining the product catalogs. She works from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m., and she has been doing this work for 4 years. With the loan, she will buy more cosmetics, such as lipstick, eye shadow, nail polish, lip and eye pencils, face powders, shampoo, etc. This will help her maintain a larger inventory and allow her to offer more variety to her customers. 

Luisa has a health problem related to her eyes; her disorder is called cataracts. Her dream is to be able to have the economic capacity to obtain medical treatment for her vision problem, and also that her business will continue to permit her to support herself. She has been a client of FAMA for three loan cycles, and she is a very responsible person.

loans.use: Buying a variety of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Wanchaq. El distrito D. Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en L. provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito D. las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos D. L. plaza D. armas D. L. capital arqueológica D. América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos D. los Incas, L. ciudad del Cusco está construida en L. base D. L. antigua ciudadeL. Inca.

Carlos tiene un pequeño taller D. automotriz donD. brinda servicios D. mantenimiento D. carros, él en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicios D. transporte públicos en su propio taxi. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios D. transportes y le va regular. Con su próximo préstamo, Carlos que espera recibir S/.800 nuevos soles es para comprar materiales para el taller como por ejemplo aceites D. carros, lubricantes, etc.

Carlos pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” D. L. Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año D. funcionamiento y está bien administrado por L. junta directiva.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his partner and two children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  It is called "The Flower District" and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza D. Armas, in the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is an enchanting city which dates back to Inca times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Carlos has a small auto repair shop where he provides a car repair service.  In his free time he provides public transport services in his own taxi.  He has been providing public transport services for several years and his business is doing ok.  He hopes to receive a loan for 800 Peruvian soles to buy materials for his auto repair shop such as, for example, car oil, lubricants, etc.

Carlos is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and well run by a board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials for his auto repair shop such as car oil, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio, de 52 años, convive con Bertha, de 46 años. Ambos tienen un hijo, Antony, de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La principal actividad de Bacilio, es la agricultura, los que hacen 20 años siembra, fertiliza y cuida con mucho esmero, pues sus sembríos de papa, arveja, y maíz, son los mejores de su localidad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica esté exitoso hombre, él también se dedica al cuidado de sus animales vacuno y ovino, como también de los burros, que le ayudan a trasportar el abono o también los productos que cosecha, en el que son luego distribuidos en la ciudad de Tarma y Huasahuasi, así como también los lleva a la ciudad de Lima. Ahora piensa sembrar arveja en menor proporción, complementando con la fortificación de sus sembríos de papa, los cuales darán un buen fruto. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y como socio antiguo de su banco comunal, se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que reciben de parte de sus integrantes. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar un saco de semillas de arveja, y varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 52 years old and lives with his common-law wife, 46 year-old Bertha.  They have one son, Antony, who is 8 years old.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

Bacilio's main business activity is farming.  He has been growing, fertilizing and carefully looking after crops for 20 years.  His potato, pea and corn crops are the best in his area.  However, this successful man does not only grow crops, he also cares for his cows, sheep and also donkeys who transport manure and also the products that he harvests.  He distributes his crops in the cities of Tarma and Huasahuasi.  He also takes them to the city of Lima.

Bacilio is thinking of growing fewer peas and strengthening his potato crops which will provide good results.  This is his seventh loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member of his community bank, he feels grateful for all the support that he receives from the other members.  He will use his loan to buy a sack of pea seeds and several sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy a sack of pea seeds and several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: La Realeza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LA REALEZA.  Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla en México.  El grupo está conformado por  9 integrantes.

Anselma S.C.Tiene 42 (años), estudió hasta la primaria, es repostera y tiene en total 2 hijos: 1 mujer y 1 varón.  Ella se dedica a la elaboración de postres que inició hace 13 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima y satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, los vecinos comentan que están complacidos en la compra de postres, en especial los flanes y las gelatinas que son muy ricos, la preferencia de clientes es por la atención, limpieza y el buen sabor de los postres. Ella vende en su comunidad y en las comunidades aledañas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta.  Quiere este crédito para comprar lo necesario en azúcar huevo y saborizantes para cumplir con los pedidos que le han hecho para día de R.. También espera con sus ganancia poder comprar un triciclo para andar en el por toda la comunidad y hacer llegar más rápido sus pedidos. Ella anhela darles una vida y educación digna a sus hijos y seguir siendo el mejor ejemplo de lucha para salir a delante.
texts.en:
This group is called LA REALEZA (The Royal Family).  It is located in the State of Puebla, in Mexico and has 9 members.

Anselma S.C. is 42 years old.  She studied at elementary school level and has 2 children: 1 girl and 1 boy.  Her business is making desserts and she started it 13 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials so that she can fill her customers' orders.  Her neighbors comment that they like buying Anselma's desserts, in particular her creme caramels and gelatin desserts which are delicious.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she provides good customer service, cleanliness and good-tasting desserts.

Anselma makes her sales in her own community and in neighboring communities.  As she requests this loan, she feels happy.  She would like this loan so that she can buy what she needs to fill the orders that she has for 'Kings Day' (6th January).  She would like to buy sugar, eggs and flavorings.  She also hopes, with her profits, to be able to buy a three-wheeled vehicle so that she can get around her whole community and make her deliveries more quickly.  She would like to provide her children with a decent life and education and to continue being the best example of how you need to work hard to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To make gelatin desserts, creme caramels and desserts in general

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 33 years old and married.  She owns a business that sells different items such as soaps, curry powder, and other items. Her husband works as a businessman.  She has been selling these items for 12 years.  Her loan will be used to buy more items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build  a house on the plot of land she bought.

loans.use: To purchase items such as soaps, curry powder, and  handbags

loans.name: Kalagi Basooka Kwavula Group-Mityana

texts.en: Obed T. is 32 years old, married, and has seven children.  He has been running his produce selling and motorcycle transportation businesses for the last decade in Kalagi-Mityana. He began these businesses out of his own enterprise after he saw the success some of his friends were having in running the same businesses. Obed is a farmer and has been successful in his  agricultural business, in that he is able to sell the cash crops he harvests from his gardens. Obed says he sees further success if he maintains his tenacity and focus.  He earns 150,000 shillings a week from both businesses. Obed belongs to Kalagi Basooka Kwavula Group-Mityana. With this loan, he is going to improve his farming gardens with high grade manure.

loans.use: To purchase high grade manure for his gardens

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent owns a restaurant. He is 36 years old and single. He has been running his restaurant for 10 years.  

His loan will be used to establish another restaurant. He hopes to use the new profits from this business for savings and for his own wedding.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, es una exitosa mujer joven y trabajadora de 23 años, que vive en casa de sus padres; junto a su esposo Jaime, de 26 años y su hijo menor Yosmel, de 3 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La actividad principal de Maribel es la agricultura, donde sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arvejas, y demás productos oriundos de la sierra peruana. Los cuales siembra hace ya 4 años, y según afirma con el esfuerzo diario, y los constantes cuidados que le brinda en compañía de su esposo, podrá obtener muchas ganancias, y con ello invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas.  Ya está dando el primer paso, con la adquisición de un espacio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde podrá obtener mejores ganancias, ya que está en un lugar estable. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Maribel, pues en sus tiempos libres, ella prepara biscochuelos y panes. Lo que más le gusta a ella es “estar activa y lograr sus objetivos”.Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal, se compromete en participar de manera activa y responsablemente. De obtener el crédito solicitado, está pensando invertir en la compra de más sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a successful and hard-working young woman of 23.  She lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 26 year-old Jaime, and her 3 year-old daughter Yosmel.  They live in their own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

Maribel is in the farming business.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and other products that are native to the Peruvian mountains.  She has been growing crops for 4 years and she says that her daily hard work and the constant attention that she gives to her crops, with her husband's help, will make a lot of profits.  She will use these profits to invest in buying more farmland.  She is taking her first step by acquiring a space in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where she will be able to obtain better profits since it is in a stable place.  However, Maribel doesn't just grow crops.  In her spare time she also bakes sponge cakes and bread.  What she most enjoys is "being active and achieving goals".

This is Maribel's second loan with MFP and, as a member of her community bank, she pledges to take part in an active and responsible manner.  She plans to invest her loan in buying more sacks of manure to spread over her different crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Residenciales Del Campo Nº 3 Group

texts.es:
Santos Blacina tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, y es integrante del Grupo Solidario Residenciales El Campo Nº 2. 

Santos se dedica a la venta de productos cosmeticos, ella decidio inscribirse al programa de venta por catalogo de Avon y como trabaja en una farmacia en sus tiempos libres hace visitas domiciliarias y va enseñando los productos en los catalogos y cuando no cuenta con mucho tiempo los deja y luego regresa. Una de sus dificultades es que da credito y algunas veces sus clientes le quedan mal con la fecha de pago. El prestamo lo necesita para comprar mas y variados productos. Los prestamos obtenidos le han ayudado a obtener su casa porque antes no tenia y ahora la esta mejorando. Unas de sus dificultades es que vende de forma ambulante y cuando le pagan ella tiene que movilizarse con dinero en efectivo y la han asaltado varias veces. Su meta es trabajar muy duro cada dia para tener un negocio en un local y terminar su vivienda. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por 21 ciclos y ha demostrado alta responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Santos Blacina is 51 years old, married, and has four children.  She is a member of the Residenciales El Campo No. 3 solidarity group.

Santos' business is selling cosmetics.  She decided to sign up to sell Avon products through a ctalog and, as she works in a pharmacy and makes home visits in her spare time, she also shows customers the products in her catalogs.  When she doesn't have much time she leaves them and then returns for them later.

One of the problems Santos has in her business is that she provides her goods on credit and sometimes her customers don't pay on time.  She needs this loan to buy more products and a better variety of products.  The loans she has had so far have helped her to obtain a house which she didn't have before and she is now making improvements to it.  Another difficulty that Santos has is that she makes her sales from door to door and when her customers pay her she has to move about with cash on her.  She has been assaulted on a couple of occasions.  Santos' goal is to work very hard every day so that she can have premises for her business and finish her home.  She has been a client of FAMA for 21 loan cycles and she has always shown herself to be very responsible in her payments.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Cosmos Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Cosmos está integrado por 9 clientas, en él se encuentra L. señora Mariana N.. Tiene 30 años, estudió hasta L. secundaria, y es comerciante, venD. zapatos por catálogo. ElL. tiene 2 hijos, L. sra nos platica que inició su negocio hace 2 años debido a L. situación económica y a que uno D. sus hijos requería tratamiento médico. Con el prestamo quiere surtir mercancía dado que incrementó sus pedidos. En este mismo grupo se encuentra L. señora Rosa Maria V. D. 40 años, estudió L. primaria, es comerciante y tuvo 7 hijos. L. Sra siempre ha trabajado vendiendo diversos productos ropa y productos D. temporada, nos platica que lleva 16 años con el negocio ya que debido a que L. familia era numerosa, L. sra  Rosa se vió en L. necesidad D. apoyar en el gasto familiar. L. Sra. Mariana vió que los pedidos iban en ascenso y solicitó el crédito para invertir en L. compra D. ropa D. temporada.
texts.en:
This group is called Cosmos and has 9 members. 

Mariana N. is one of the group's members.  She is 30 years old and studied up to high school level.  She is a saleswoman and sells shoes through a catalog.  She has two children.  Mariana tells us that she started her business 2 years ago because of her economic situation and because one of her children needed medical treatment.  Mariana would like to use her loan to stock up with merchandise as her orders have increased.

Rosa Maria Vázquez is another member of this group.  She is 40 years old, studied to elementary school level, is a saleswoman and has 7 children.  She has always worked selling different products such as clothes and seasonal products.  She tells us that she has been in this business for 16 years since, as she has a large family, Rosa has to support her family's expenses.  She saw that her orders were increasing and requested this loan so that she could invest in buying seasonal clothes.

loans.use: To invest in buying merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria es una persona muy seria y respetuosa ella solicita  el préstamo por que quiere comprar mas mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes ya que donde ella tiene su negocio es casi en la salida de piedras negras a ella le gustaría surtir mas su tienda de abarrotes para así poder brindarle mas variedad a su clientela, el negocio lo manejan entre los dos su esposo y la Sra. gloria, ella desea poner en un futuro un negocio de comida.
texts.en: Gloria is a very serious and respectful person.  She is requesting this loan as she would like to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.  Her business is located almost at the exit of Piedras Negras.  She would like to better stock her grocery stock so that she can provide her customers with more variety.  She and her husband run the business.  In the future, Gloria would like to set up a food business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
Noemí Maura, es casada, tiene 54 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad.
Actualmente es la tesorera del grupo “SARITA COLONIA”, el cual ya lleva cuatro años de formación y se encuentra integrado por 10 socias que residen en la zona de Comas.
Desde hace 2 años la Sra. Noemí se dedica a la venta de productos de necesidad en su bodega. Se inicia en este negocio vendiendo golosinas como ambulante, así es como Noemí decide poner este negocio y es así como inicia una fuente de ingresos para su hogar, permitiéndole mejorarar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos y crecer gracias a la dedicación que le brinda a su pequeño negocio.
Con su trabajo ha logrado incrementar su mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad, permitiéndole  ahorrar e invertir mucho mas. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en su negocio (compra de mercadería y panetones para esta campaña navideña).
texts.en:
Noemí Maura is married, is 54 years old, and has three adult children. 

She is the treasure of the group called “SARITA COLONIA,” which was formed four years ago and made up of 10 members who live in the Comas zone.

Noemí has been selling personal products in her shop for the past two years.  She started this business by selling snacks on foot and this lead to this business and a source of household income.  This allowed her to improve her and her children’s quality of life, thanks to the dedication she gives her small business.

Her work has allowed her to increase her inventory, allowing her to offer her customers a larger variety of items, and to save and invest much more.  She will use the money from this loan to invest into her business (merchandise and pants for this Christmas season).

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Carmen Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijos; la socia trabaja en la cooperativa de ahorro y crédito Santo Domingo de Guzmán, ella es contadora y pertenece al banco comunal desde hace 6 años, le gusta la modalidad del grupo en cuanto al ahorro y es un grupo muy cumplido y son amigos desde hace muchos años, ellos también hacen actividades en grupo y lo que reúnen lo ahorran hasta fin de año cuando pueden repartirse sus ahorros y tener una buena navidad, la socia ahora requiere el préstamo para comprar algo personal ella indica que desea comprarse una casaca y con las fiestas navideñas dio regalos a todos y ella no pudo comprarse nada y que ahora desea hacerlo e ir pagando de a pocos. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Padre Eterno" ["Eternal Father"] community bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Carmen. She is 38, single, and has one child. She works in the Santo Domingo de Guzman savings and lending cooperative. She is an accountant and has belonged to the community bank for 6 years. She likes the group's saving methods, and it is a very punctual group. They have been friends for many years. They also do group work and they save what they make until the end of the year when they can divide out their savings and have a good Christmas. Carmen now requires a loan to purchase some personal items. She says that she wants to buy a jacket, and gifts for everyone for the upcoming Christmas holidays. She could not buy anything and she now wants to take the loan and pay bit by bit. She is requesting this loan for personal use. She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay the quotas as established.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for personal use.

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
Victor de 58 años, es un hombre trabajador que siempre le ha gustado tener su propio dinero por eso que hace 6 años comenzó con su negocio de la papelería para así ayudar a su familia a mantener su hogar. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ahora trabaja en su propio negocio desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm atendiendo a los clientes. Vende en su papelería plumas, juguetes, cuadernos, accesorios etc. Aunque uno de los problemas que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive sigue trabajando para poder asegurar su vejez. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes y cuadernos para su negocio para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere agrandar el negocio y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is 58 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has always liked having his own money.  For this reason, 6 years ago he started his stationery business so that he could help his family and support his household.

Victor lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  He works in his own business from 7.00am to 10.00pm, serving his customers.  In his stationery store he sells pens, toys, exercise books, accessories, etc.  Although he faces problems with the crime in his area, he continues working so that he can guarantee his old age.

Victor would like to use his loan to buy toys and exercise books for his business so that his customers have more variety when they come to make their purchases.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy toys and exercise books

loans.name: Maritza Del Pilar

texts.en:
Maritza Del Pilar is a 48 year old, single entrepreneur. When she was a little girl she learned how to make clothes. She has been designing and making clothes for more than 10 years now. She also sells sodas and juices at her store. Maritza has two children who are both married. Her daughter, who lives close by, helps making clothes and selling drinks at her store. 

Maritza lives in an area in the south of Guayaquil, called Isla Trinitaria. This area is known for its lawlessness and its scant basic services. Luckily Maritza's home is made of cement and has electricity and water. Due to unsafe conditions in the area, it is sometimes too dangerous in the street, forcing Maritza to close her store early. 

Maritza will use the loan to buy material needed to make and repair clothes and to buy drinks to sell in her store.
In the future Martiza hopes to open a small store and to fix the top floor of her house. She would also like to have a place to design high quality clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes and to buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Ramila

texts.ru:
Ramila A. 46 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Ramila yeyo muj i deti jivut v qorode Baku. 
Uje 5  let kak Ramila zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsay v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe produktov dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Ramila A. is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, who are college student. Ramila  lives with her husband and children in the city of Baku.

For the last five years, Ramila has been in business selling groceries. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store space  and be able to accommodate more wares.

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Duo Getzemani Group

texts.es:
duo GETZEMANI

LUCIA V.
