She has a business selling food for social events and she will use her loan to buy the necessary items to prepare for the banquets, in addition to some housing arrangements. Mrs. Rosalía has been in the business for 10 years.  She says that it was her mother-in-law who taught her to prepare food and then thought to offer their services for peoples' parties, starting with small festivities and gradually are looking for large events. She says that she is satisfied greatly when people tell her that her food is tasty and hire her for another event. She works mainly out of her home and the people who hire her either come to her residence for the food or sometimes she is hired to serve at parties. Her business is important to her because it gives her an income and profits to raise her family and pay for the expenses. 

Her favorite part of the business is to produce food for the event because she likes to cook and feels great satisfaction when people say that her food is tasty. The people who help with the business are of all ages, regularly attending 2-3 events a week in the month of December and January because this is when banquet orders increase. Mrs. Rosalía does not have competition because she is the only one who provides that kind of service in the town. Earnings are used to buy whatever it takes for her business, to buy grills, pots and even the cost of her home.

Mrs. Rosalía is married and her husband is a federal employee. She has 3 children: Julio César, 28 and works in the U.S., Humberto, 21 and works in a pharmacy, and Briceida, 16 and in preparatory school. Also, the wife of her son Julio César lives in her house. Her daughter-in-law helps with the work and participates in the profits. Axochiapan is very nice and she enjoys living there because it is quiet and she knows and lives with neighbors. She greatly values her business because it helps to raise her family, when they get sick or need for an emergency. 

Some home improvements she wants to make are plastering the walls of her home, buying iron and glass for doors and windows. Her future plans are to build a house at the same location and leave an inheritance for her children. She intends to achieve these things with the help of loans. Mrs. Rosalía wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the help you have given me for my business to continue running. Many thanks.”

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, spices, red and green mole.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María A. González vive en la cabecera municipal del municipio de Axochiapan en el estado de Morelos, México. Actualmente tiene 70 años no cursó la educación básica. Ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes y va a ocupar el préstamo de KIVA y Fundación Realidad para surtir su negocio, va comprar principalmente productos de la canasta básica para vender en su tienda. Además de productos básicos vende  refrescos, botanas, juguetes y regalos para toda ocasión. Su tienda se llama “tienda mary”. Lleva con su negocio 20 años nos comenta que lo inició por necesidad al quedar viuda tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos; inició lavando y planchando ajeno, pero como no le alcanzaba decidió aprender a elaborar queso y crema, ya sobrellevaba la situación económica de su familia cuando decidió además vender un poco de abarrotes afuera de su casa en una mesita y poco a poco fue metiendo mas producto, compró un refrigerador y comenzó a vender refrescos y así fue creciendo su negocio. Después una vecina le platicó de los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad y pensó que era una buena oportunidad para darle un mayor impulso a su negocio. Des pues compró el terreno en el que actualmente vive y en donde tiene su negocio.
La señora María es viuda tiene 4 hijas y 1 un hijo, todos son casados e independientes, le ayudan dándole dinero periódicamente para sus gastos y a veces para invertir en su tienda. Le llena  de orgullo que todas sus propiedades las ha adquirido con el producto de su trabajo y por eso disfruta atender cada día a sus clientes y hacer todas las actividades de su tienda. |en promedio atiende 50 personas al día, considera que su negocio es popular porque sus clientes encuentran de todo y porque los atiende bien. Algunos de los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el aumento de la competencia, pero ella menciona que aun con todo le va bien. Las ganancias de su negocio normalmente las invierten en más mercancía, está planeando ampliar su tienda comprando más vitrinas para exhibir más mercancías y atender mejor a sus clientes. Una parte importante de estos planes los piensa lograr con los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad.
Le gusta mucho su localidad porque como ella misma comenta “…por eso me gusta mi pueblo (Axochiapan), porque es un lugar de negocios, todo lo que uno ofrece se vende…”  se siente feliz con el otorgamiento de su préstamo porque va a poder llevar a cabo sus metas, sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA son: “…les agradezco por el préstamo que me hicieron y que ayuden a más gente…”
texts.en:
María A. González lives in the center of the municipality of Axochiapan in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 70 years old and did not undertake basic education.  She has a grocery store.  She will use the loan from Kiva and Fundación Realidad to supply her business.  She is going to buy mainly basic items to sell in her store.  In addition to basic items, she sells sodas, snacks, toys, and gifts for all occasions.  Her store is called "Tienda Mary" ("Mary's Store").  She has been in business for 20 years.  She tells us that she started the business out of necessity upon becoming a widow, when she had to provide for her children.  She began by doing washing and ironing, but as this did not bring in enough, she decided to learn to make cheese and cream.  The family's economic situation became bearable when she decided to also sell a few groceries outside of her house on a little table.  Bit by bit, she added more products.  She bought a refrigerator and began to sell sodas, and in this way her business grew.  Later, a neighbor told her about the loans from Kiva and Fundación Realidad, and she thought it was a good opportunity to give her business a bigger push.  Afterwards, she bought the land where she currently lives and where she has her business.

María is a widow and has 4 daughters and 1 son, all married and independent.  They help her by giving her money periodically for her expenses and sometimes they invest in her store.  She is full of pride at the fact that everything she has she acquired with the fruits of her labor, and therefore she enjoys serving her customers each day and doing all of the tasks needed in her store.  On average, she has 50 customers a day.  She thinks her business is profitable because her customers find everything there, and because she provides them with good service.  One of the challenges facing her business is the increase in competition, but she notes that even with everything, she is doing well.  She normally invests the earnings from her business in more merchandise, and she is planning to enlarge her store by buying more display cases to exhibit more merchandise and serve her clients better.  She plans to achieve a significant part of those plans with loans from Kiva and Fundación Realidad.  

She likes her town a lot because, as she herself says, "...that's why I like my town (Axochiapan), because it's a place for businesses, everything one could offer is for sale..."  She is happy about the granting of the loan because it will enable her to achieve her goals.  Her words for the Kiva team are: "...I thank them for the loan they made me, and may they help more people..."

loans.use: To buy soap, bleach, crates of eggs, sodas, purified water, snacks

loans.name: Heraclio

texts.es: Heraclio, de 60 años, está casado con Sabina, de 59 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos Herman, de 24 y Rosa, de 19 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. Esté emprendedor hombre se dedica a la siembra intensiva, ya que compra semilla de papa y arveja, en grandes cantidades; para sembrarlos en sus más de 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que viaja cada 6 meses a la ciudad de Arequipa, para comercializar no solo su cosecha, también la semilla que se produce en la zona, Para dinamizar su negocio, Heraclio, está pensando adquirir una camioneta, para poder trasladar su mercadería de ciudad en ciudad, con mayor facilidad. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal, se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de pertenecer a una asociación responsable. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de 30 mil kilos de semilla de arveja. Según menciona una parte lo esparcirá en sus sembríos y la otra parte los comercializará.
texts.en: Heraclio, who is 60 years old, is married to Sabina, who is 59 years old.  Together they have 5 children.  Two of their children, 24 yea- old Herman and 19 year-old Rosa, live at home.  Their family lives in their own home in the town of San Juan. This enterprising man makes his living in intensive agriculture.  He purchases potato and pea seeds in large quantities and plants them in his 4+ hectares of farm land.  He makes a good profit since every 6 months he travels to the city of Arequipa to sell not only his harvest but also the seeds that are produced in the area.  In order to energize his business, Heraclio is thinking of acquiring a pick-up truck; he could then more easily transport his merchandise from city to city.  This is his first loan with MFP, and as a new member of the communal bank he feels thankful for the opportunity to belong to a responsible association.  Once he receives his requested loan, he will invest it in the purchase of 30 kilos of pea seed.  As previously mentioned, some of the seed will used for planting, and some will be sold.

loans.use: To purchase 30 kilos of pea seeds.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maximiliana; La socia tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia elabora a mano bellos trabajos de arcilla y los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja  junto a su familia de tal modo que este trabajo les ayuda en casa a más de 4 personas. La socia requiere l crédito para poder comprar mercadería y materia prima para la adquisición de arcilla de primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member's name is Sra. Maximiliana.  She is 55 years old, is a single mother of 2 children and makes her living buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes beautiful hand-crafted pottery, paints the works herself and adds all the finishing touches.  She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq.  Sra. Maximiliana works closely with her family such that her work helps support more than 4 people.  She needs the loan to be able to purchase merchandise and raw materials, like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints.  She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

Sra. Maximiliana is happy with the loan that has been granted and she promises to make her payments in the established re-payment timetable.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in raw materials.

loans.name: Las Golosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las golosas porque una de sus integrantes vende una marca que así se llama. Está ubicado en Puebla, México y está conformado por  nueve integrantes.
 
Cristina R. H. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 29 años, estudió hasta 1er. año de secundaria, es comerciante y tiene 1 hijo varón.  Ella se dedica al comercio de lencería y zapato por catálogo que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de lencería y solicitar sus pedidos de zapatos. Sus clientes prefieren solicitar los pedidos con nuestra clienta a razón de que se los entrega con prontitud.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta por adquirir este crédito.   Quiere este préstamo para adquirir un local comercial que le rentan en un buen precio. Su mayor objetivo es sacar adelante a su hijo y ofrecerle una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Golosas" because one of their members sells a brand by the same name.  They are located in Puebla, Mexico and their group is made up of nine members.
 
Cristina R. H. is the president of the group.  She is 29 years old, completed her first year of secondary school, is a sales woman and has 1 son.  She makes her living selling shoes through a catalog and lingerie.  She started her business 5 years ago.  Cristina is requesting the loan in order to purchase lingerie and to place her shoe orders.  Her customers prefer to place their orders with Cristina because she delivers their purchases promptly.  She feels very happy about acquiring the loan at the time she requested it.  She wants the loan in order to secure a retail space that is being rented at a good price.  Her main objective is to allow her son to get ahead and to offer him a better way of life.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie and to place her shoe orders.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanía, la socia elabora a mano trabajos D. arcilla con motivos andinos, los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja  con su esposo y parte D. sus hijos, este se convirtió en un negocio familiar los últimos dos años. La socia requiere el crédito para poder comprar mercadería y materia prima para la adquisición D. arcilla D. primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in the Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member's name is Sra. Maria.  She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children.  She makes her living buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes hand-maD. Andean-style pottery, paints the pottery herself and adds all the finishing touches. She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq.  Sra. Maria works with her husband and some of her children; it became a family business in the last two years.  She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints.  She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

Sra. Maria is happy with the loan that has been granted, and she promises to make her payments in accordance with the established re-payment schedule.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan, de 19 años, es un joven soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Ana, de 39 años, y su papa Edgar, de 42 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. Esté emprendedor hombre se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales siembras constan de papa, arveja y olluco; los cuales después de mucho cuidado y abonamiento, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su esfuerzo y trabajo le permitió adquirir una hectárea de terreno agrícola. Paralelo a está actividad, Jhonatan, también lleva cada 15 días, papa en grandes cantidades a Lima, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, tanto así, que ahora quiere convertirse en un exitoso mayorista. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal, se compromete en ser puntual con los pagos mensuales. De obtener el crédito solicitado, comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en: Jhonatan is 19 years old and is a young, single and hardworking man.  He lives in the company of his 39-year-old mother, Ana, and his 42-year-old father, Edgar.  They live in their own house located in the San Juan area.  This enterprising man works in agriculture and his main crops consist of potatoes, peas and ‘olluco’ (an Andean tuber) which, after a great deal of care and fertilizer, he sells in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  His effort and work allowed him to obtain a hectare of farming land.  Along with this job, Jhonatan also brings large quantities of potatoes to Lima every 15 days where he earns good money – so much so that he now wants to become a successful wholesaler.  This is his second loan with MFP and as a new member of his communal bank, he promises to make his monthly payments on time.  With the loan requested, he will purchase two bags of pea seeds.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Wilker

texts.es: Wilker, de 21 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador; que vive en compañía de sus padres, en la localidad de San Juan. Con la vitalidad propia de un joven, Wilker, no para de trabajar, y a pesar de su corta edad hace 4 años, que se dedica a la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y habas; los cuales después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo tiene un negocio de compra y venta, de papa al por mayor, los cuales lleva cada 15 días a la capital del país. Pero, como quiere dinamizar sus ventas, y mejorar sus ganancias Wilker está pensando adquirir un camión, para poder trasportar su mercadería sin mayores inconvenientes. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal; se siente agradecido por el apoyo brindado. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja, asimismo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilker is 21 years old.  He is a hard-working, single man who lives with his parents in the town of San Juan.  With a young man's vitality, Wilker doesn't stop working and, in spite of his young age, he has been farming for four years.  His main crops are potatoes, peas and beans.  After each harvest he sells his produce in the wholesale market in the city of Terma.  He also has a business buying and selling potatoes wholesale.  Every 15 days he transports them to the country's capital.  However, as he would like to energize his sales and improve his profits, Wilker is thinking of acquiring a truck so that he can transport his merchandise more easily.

This is Wilker's second loan from MFP and, as a new member of his community bank, he is grateful for the support he is being offered.  He will invest his loan money in buying several sacks of pea seeds and merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eufemia; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanía, la socia elabora a mano y a máquina chompas D. alpaca, mantas, medias, gorras, chalinas, guantes y mucho más, también compra artesanía popular, llaveros al por mayor, aretes y otros. La socia requiere el crédito para poder tener capital D. trabajo y esto reinvertirlo en la compra D. mercadería para implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración D. chompas y otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Inti Quilla communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Eufemia is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She works buying and selling handicrafts and makes alpaca sweaters, blankets, socks, hats, scarves, gloves and many other items by hand and using a machine. She also purchases traditional handicrafts such as wholesale key chains, earrings, and other items. Eufemia needs the loan to be able to have working capital to reinvest in the purchase of merchandise for her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make sweaters and other items.

Eufemia is happy for the loan granted and she promises to make her loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making sweaters and other items

loans.name: Esequiel

texts.es: Esequiel, de 50 años, está casado con Marcelina, de 48 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arverja y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los que compró gracias a sus 20 años de dedicación. Lo que más le gusta a Esequiel es poder comercializar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pues ve sus esfuerzos concretados. Paralelo a está actividad, Esequiel, se dedica a la ganadería, donde cuida de sus animales entre vacas, toros, y corderos; además que de la leche que extrae puede hacer queso. El trabajo de campo es su vida, por ello está pensando en mejorar sus sembríos. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y está seguro que obtendrá buenos resultados con el trabajo que realizan en su banco comunal, donde recibe charlas constantemente. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá invertir en la compra de 3 sacos de semilla de alverja, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en: Esequiel is 50 years and is married to Marcelina, who is 48 years old.  They have five children, but only live with four of them in a house that they own located in the San Juan area.  He works in farming and his main crops consist of potatoes, peas and beans.  He grows them on his own farmlands which he bought thanks to his 20 years of dedication to the business.  What Esequiel likes most is being able to sell his crops in his city’s wholesale market, as he sees his efforts paying off.  Along with this job, Esequiel works in cattle farming where he cares for his animals, such as cows, bulls and lambs.  He can also make cheese with the milk that he obtains from them.  Working in the field is his life and for this reason, he is planning to improve his crops.  This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is sure that he will have good results because of the work done in his communal bank, where he constantly attends talks.  In obtaining the loan requested, he will be able to invest in the purchase of three sacks of pea seeds and if he has enough money left, he will buy several sacks of natural fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Yolinda

texts.es: Yolinda, de 18 años, está casada con Javier, de 23 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Mayvet, de un año de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. Hace 2 años se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa y alverja, los cuales abona y cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que quiere darle un buen futuro a su hija. El trabajo arduo que mantuvo durante todo este tiempo, le permitió adquirir su propio terreno agrícola. Ahora después de cada cosecha, ella lleva su producción al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde puede observar la demanda de los productos; por ello hace algún tiempo sembró papa, los que están creciendo sin mayores complicaciones. Como es joven en este negocio, quiere mejorar sus sembríos, y convertirse en una excelente agricultora. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, agradece la oportunidad que le ofrecen, comprometiéndose a trabajar con esfuerzo. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo podrá invertir en la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Yolinda is 18 years old.  She is married to 23 year-old Javier and they have one child: one year-old Mayvet.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the town of San Juan.

Yolinda has been farming for 2 years.  Her main crops are potatoes and peas which she looks after with a lot of commitment since she would like to provide her daughter with a good future.  The hard work that she has done over the years have enabled her to acquire her own plot of farmland.  After each harvest, she takes her produce to the wholesale market in Tarma, where she can observe the demand for products.  As a result, she has been growing potatoes for some time.  They are growing without real problems.  As she is new in this business, Yolinda would like to improve her crops and become an excellent farmer.

This is Yolinda's first loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she is grateful for the opportunity that they are offering her and pledges to work hard.  She will invest her loan in buying 2 sacks of pea seeds which she will sow on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Darwin Joffre

texts.en:
Darwin Joffre lives in the southeastern part of Guayaquil, an area called Fortin. His house is made partly of cane and partly of cement. He has electricity but no running water. Darwin Joffre has had a passion for baking ever since he was a child. His father was a baker and he learned the profession from him. Fifteen years ago, Darwin Joffre started his own bakery.

Darwin Joffre’s days start early, at 4 a.m., when he and his wife start baking the bread. He bakes bread and sweets. He also sells drinks at his bakery. During the week his wife helps at the bakery, and during the weekend she works as a cleaning lady. Darwin Joffre has two sons (aged seven and four) and the older one goes to public school. Due to the increase in crime in his neighborhood he has had to put bars in front of his store.

Darwin Joffre plans to use his loan to buy an oven ($500), flour in bulk ($300), and yeast ($50). In the future he hopes to continue improving his house with cement, and he wants his children to graduate.

loans.use: To buy an oven, flour, and yeast.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es: Isabel tiene 65 años y vive en Huaycan, tiene  hijos y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 1 año y medio junto al grupo “El Progreso D. la Amistad”, grupo conformado por 11 vecinas y amigas que pusieron este nombre por la relación que las une. Isabel trabaja lavando ropa, en limpieza D. hogares desD. hace 15 años, además venD. juguetes, además D. colaborar en Construcción D. casas. Antes trabajaba en la Municipalidad  D. barrendera y fue por dos años,  últimamente tuvo que cubrir los gastos del sepelio D. su madre, pero ella está contenta por seguir trabajando y con el último préstamo comprara juguetes para vender en la campaña naviD.ña y espera que Edaprospo le ayuD. con las habilitaciones.
texts.en: Isabel is 65 years old, lives in Huaycan and has children.  She has been working with Edaprospo for a year and a half together with the group called “El Progreso D. la Amistad” (The Progress of Friendship).  The group is maD. up of 11 neighbors and friends who gave their group its name because of the relationship that unites them.  Isabel has worked washing clothing and cleaning houses for the last 15 years.  In addition, she sells toys and collaborates on housing construction.  She previously worked for two years as a street sweeper in the city.  Recently, she had to cover the costs of her mother's burial.  But she is happy to continue working and with her recent loan she will purchase toys to sell during the Christmas season. She hopes that Edaprospo can help her with the authorizations.

loans.use: To purchase products and supplies.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Violeta; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, ella trae de la ciudad de Lima, también viaja a Bolivia y trae ropa de todo tipo y de diferentes tallas para mujeres y varones, la socia ya tiene aquí sus clientes fijos y cada vez que ella tien mercadería nueva ella los visita y reparte sus prendas después de unas semanas pasa para cobrar la primera parte del dinero y en las siguientes dos semanas el total de las prendas. La socia trabaja con instituciones grandes de este modo ella tiene un mercado seguro. La socia desea el préstamo para poder viajar a traer nueva mercadería aprovechando que en la ciudad de Lima comenzó el verano y muchas fábricas están liquidando las prendas de invierno.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Inti Quilla" communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Violeta.  She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one son.  Violeta buys and sells clothing.  She brings clothing from the city of Lima and also travels to Bolivia.  She brings back all types of clothing, in different sizes for both men and women.  She has regular customers  and each time that she has new merchandise, she visits them and offers her garments for sale.  After a few weeks, she goes back to collect the first part of their payment, and in the following two weeks, she collects the total price for each garment.  Violeta works with large establishments, so she has a reliable market.  She is requesting this loan in order to be able to travel to bring back new merchandise.  She would like to take advantage of the fact that in the city of Lima, the summer is beginning and many factories are liquidating their winter garments.

Violeta is happy to receive this loan and she promises to comply with her established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing
